commit_message:
Remove useless NotFound exception catching for v2/v2.1 fping

There is useless NotFound exception catching around "_get_instance_ips",
but deep into the code, there isn't any code will raise that exception.
This patch removes those useless code.

Change-Id: Ib980ad6e2932f90c93a2144e5b8711abd468b9be

commit_message:
allow --endpoint-type internal|admin|public

other openstack clients like glance, cinder  use --endpoint-type
(internal|admin|public). This allows users to use the same arguments
with the nova cli.

Partial-bug: #1367389

Change-Id: Ia55cad797ac0dca7fa60f55c1f2dfba0b64d0fd3

subject: Collapse endpoints from services that are the same in the catalog
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-26 01:09:01.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/service_catalog.py'], 'message': 'Collapse endpoints from services that are the same in the catalog

If two services claim to be exactly the same type, to avoid cases
where only the last entry in the catalog is represented to the
clients, merge the endpoints into a single list. This will avoid
EndPointNotFound errors where a client is asking for an endpoint
that would otherwise be found if it had been listed later in the
service catalog.

Change-Id: Icafd19ec9576ceea7c808697602aa702afc37df1
Closes-Bug: #1425766
'}]
commit_message:
Collapse endpoints from services that are the same in the catalog

If two services claim to be exactly the same type, to avoid cases
where only the last entry in the catalog is represented to the
clients, merge the endpoints into a single list. This will avoid
EndPointNotFound errors where a client is asking for an endpoint
that would otherwise be found if it had been listed later in the
service catalog.

Change-Id: Icafd19ec9576ceea7c808697602aa702afc37df1
Closes-Bug: #1425766

commit_message:
Register CloudServer as OS::Nova::Server

Register CloudServer as OS::Nova::Server so it waits on the
RackConnect and Managed Cloud automations.  Remove the extra attributes
and properties from CloudServer so it is compatible with OS::Nova::Server.

Change-Id: Idded2458291d8321f0ff404be360322d984595e6

commit_message:
Use devstack plugin in CI hooks

We have devstack plugin stored in dir 'devstack' and now we do not need
extras.d hooks anymore, stored in dir 'contrib/devstack'.

Switch CI scripts for usage of devstack plugin and remove extras.d hooks.

Change-Id: I49008d169758710df81bf8bbc6ec9d455f162ba1

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13050, 'name': 'VMWare Congress CI', 'email': 'congressci@gmail.com', 'username': 'vmware-congress-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 04:35:17.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/accounts.py'], 'message': "Fix missing variable in test accounts warning log

In the remove_hash test accounts method we log a warning message to
indicate that a hash has already been cleaned and the pseudo-lock file
isn't there. The intent of that log message was to indicate the lock
file path in the warning. However the string never passed the hash_path
variable so instead %s was being printed. This commit fixes the issue
so the proper path will be in the warning log.

Change-Id: I87b66e3222452200996020c349cf05cb842114bf
"}]
commit_message:
Fix missing variable in test accounts warning log

In the remove_hash test accounts method we log a warning message to
indicate that a hash has already been cleaned and the pseudo-lock file
isn't there. The intent of that log message was to indicate the lock
file path in the warning. However the string never passed the hash_path
variable so instead %s was being printed. This commit fixes the issue
so the proper path will be in the warning log.

Change-Id: I87b66e3222452200996020c349cf05cb842114bf

subject: package-installs: work with Python < 2.7
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 12092, 'name': 'Abel Lopez', 'email': 'abelopez@cisco.com', 'username': 'alopgeek'}, {'_account_id': 14611, 'name': 'dasm', 'display_name': 'dasm', 'email': 'dsmigiel@redhat.com', 'username': 'dasm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-25 16:47:17.000000000', 'files': ['elements/package-installs/bin/package-installs-v2'], 'message': 'package-installs: work with Python < 2.7

subprocess.check_output() has been introduced in Python 2.7, so the
script will fail when trying to install stuff in guests with Python 2.6
and older (like RHEL 6 / CentOS 6, for example).

Thus gracefully fallback to subprocess.Popen() when
subprocess.check_output() is not available.

Change-Id: I335148397932177810f095a942b993b249991107
Closes-Bug: #1415240
'}]
commit_message:
package-installs: work with Python < 2.7

subprocess.check_output() has been introduced in Python 2.7, so the
script will fail when trying to install stuff in guests with Python 2.6
and older (like RHEL 6 / CentOS 6, for example).

Thus gracefully fallback to subprocess.Popen() when
subprocess.check_output() is not available.

Change-Id: I335148397932177810f095a942b993b249991107
Closes-Bug: #1415240

commit_message:
Hide prompt in batch/pipe mode

Currently cliff prints prompt in batch/pipe mode:

I-AM-A-PROMPT$ echo file | cliffdemo
(cliffdemo) +---------------+--------------+
| Field         | Value        |
+---------------+--------------+
| Name          | .            |
| Size          | 4096         |
| UID           | 1124         |
| GID           | 1000         |
| Modified Time | 1424473806.9 |
+---------------+--------------+
(cliffdemo) I-AM-A-PROMPT$

This change removes the prompt when batch/pipe mode is detected:

I-AM-A-PROMPT$ echo file | cliffdemo
+---------------+--------------+
| Field         | Value        |
+---------------+--------------+
| Name          | .            |
| Size          | 4096         |
| UID           | 1124         |
| GID           | 1000         |
| Modified Time | 1424473806.9 |
+---------------+--------------+
I-AM-A-PROMPT$

Change-Id: Id17b3a3a4e63f24a0f5db92fb9fe71180ce752e2
Closes-Bug: #1381680

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 14:51:59.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_tempest/templates/openstack_tempest_gate.sh.j2'], 'message': 'Fail when no tests are run

Currently when testr fails to list any tests, no tests are run, so none
fail so the tempest script exits with success.

This patch adds some error handling around testr list-tests so that
errors are output to the console and the script halts on error.

There are also two tests added to check that full_test_list and
test_list are not empty.

Change-Id: Ieeb5957c9e47489a90a29c6f5aef166ad4e8c11e
Closes-Bug: #1425318
'}]
commit_message:
Fail when no tests are run

Currently when testr fails to list any tests, no tests are run, so none
fail so the tempest script exits with success.

This patch adds some error handling around testr list-tests so that
errors are output to the console and the script halts on error.

There are also two tests added to check that full_test_list and
test_list are not empty.

Change-Id: Ieeb5957c9e47489a90a29c6f5aef166ad4e8c11e
Closes-Bug: #1425318

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-25 23:46:23.000000000', 'files': ['shade/__init__.py'], 'message': "Do not allow to pass *-cache on init

Caches will be useful to query for facts once and
then store them. But allowing to pass a list

Change-Id: Ib3ea94ec3d014f4fe5d4480d779056bc5722de13

commit_message:
Do not allow to pass *-cache on init

Caches will be useful to query for facts once and
then store them. But allowing to pass a list
of known facts could lead in shade consuming facts
that aren't reflecting the cloud behaviour, so
removing that possibility.

Change-Id: Ib3ea94ec3d014f4fe5d4480d779056bc5722de13

commit_message:
Add a check in updating a host aggregate

In updating a host aggregate,
add an availability zone check when a compute node belongs
to 2 or more host aggregates in order to prevent
the compute node from belonging to different availability zones.

Change-Id: Ifd09ae8e2278e6895810cdf55ee1a79d5b50c2ea
Closes-Bug: #1419605

commit_message:

This change is necessary here as there is no simple way to change HelpAction's
behaviour without completely re-writing it.

oslo-config-generator is used to generate config sample iterating all
entry points provided to it.

commit_message:
Add exception handling for entry points

oslo-config-generator is used to generate config sample iterating all
entry points provided to it.
But if some error appears, return code will be absent.
It is critical to have it running in CI.
So, add new func that will be used for error handling and provide it
to stevedore that suppresses all errors by default.

Change-Id: Ia78cc0d4e8ab842cd0e279713badd68606a67a58
Closes-Bug: #1419458

commit_message:
Nuage core plugin decomposition

Taking out Nuage's core plugin out of tree and putting
it at nuage's github repository.
https://github.com/nuage-networks/nuage-openstack-neutron

Change-Id: I6d02df85c7a2c307ad11442d0afdd50c64210af4
Partially-implements: blueprint core-vendor-decomposition
Closes-bug: #1422930

commit_message:
Add hasExtension method to check cloud capabilities

This method will be using an extension_cache that will query
for the extensions to the cloud, then check if the extension
asked is present on the list or not.

Change-Id: I6f018d03e6314579435b042faf5d24b1f0473685

commit_message:
**kwargs in create_image_and_boot_instances only for server

remove double usage of **kwargs in create_image_and_boot_instances for
server and image creation, because arguments can not be used for both.
**kwargs should only be used for server creation in this context.

Change-Id: I5fcc7211ec4a6381deec6ca304162d167ec98862

commit_message:
Custom zone name prefix not being used by brcd driver

Config file setting for zone name prefix and activate flag were
not being picked up by the brocade zone driver.  Modified the
way the config options are used for each fabric for these config
options.

Closes-Bug: #1373130
Change-Id: Ib5598e58589aa4316e6c8b9b495beec9db2a4b96

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-15 15:46:53.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': 'Fix rabbit driver use of ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3

The rabbit driver required that ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 is defined, but
not all Python implementations define it.

The code was changed so that the "sslv3" value is only allowed for
the "kombu_ssl_version" version if ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 is defined in
the Python standard library.

The title of the commit in master was:

 Remove the use of PROTOCOL_SSLv3

but this was changed since it didn't describe the actual change.

Closes-Bug: #1395095
Change-Id: I2c1977c3bfc1923bcb03744e909f2e70c7fdb14c
(cherry picked from commit 42f55a1dda96d4ceecf8cca5fba9cd723673f6e3)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbit driver use of ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3

The rabbit driver required that ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 is defined, but
not all Python implementations define it.

The code was changed so that the "sslv3" value is only allowed for
the "kombu_ssl_version" version if ssl.PROTOCOL_SSLv3 is defined in
the Python standard library.

The title of the commit in master was:

 Remove the use of PROTOCOL_SSLv3

but this was changed since it didn't describe the actual change.

Closes-Bug: #1395095
Change-Id: I2c1977c3bfc1923bcb03744e909f2e70c7fdb14c
(cherry picked from commit 42f55a1dda96d4ceecf8cca5fba9cd723673f6e3)

HTTPInternalServerError 500 response is returned to the user while
image server is down during downloading the image. When glance tries
to download the image from the remote location (image server) which
is down, Connection refused ECONNREFUSED error is raised on the
glance server.

Raised RemoteServiceUnavailable exception from glance_store and handle
it in v1 and v2 api's to return 503 HTTPServiceUnavailable response
to user.

Note: Please refer below link to check glance_store related changes

Change-Id: I45099153e75d53b028e249fad8a4d944d38adf65

commit_message:
Glance returns HTTP 500 for image download

HTTPInternalServerError 500 response is returned to the user while
image server is down during downloading the image. When glance tries
to download the image from the remote location (image server) which
is down, Connection refused ECONNREFUSED error is raised on the
glance server.

Raised RemoteServiceUnavailable exception from glance_store and handle
it in v1 and v2 api's to return 503 HTTPServiceUnavailable response
to user.

Note: Please refer below link to check glance_store related changes
which addresses this issue partially.
I065b9a3e8e674ea74ff8563aad99d7d022417caa

Closes-Bug: #1379798
Change-Id: I45099153e75d53b028e249fad8a4d944d38adf65

There are no boto imports in glance anymore since the s3 driver moved
out with glance_store, so remove the boto requirement from glance.

Also cleans up an old install reference for RPMs.

subject: Do not use '/tmp' as default guestagent log location
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5293, 'name': 'Nikhil', 'email': 'SlickNik@gmail.com', 'username': 'slicknik'}, {'_account_id': 7806, 'name': 'Sushil Kumar', 'email': 'skm.net@gmail.com', 'username': 'sushilkm'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 9746, 'name': 'Doug Shelley', 'email': 'dougshelley66@gmail.com', 'username': 'dougshelley'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 13355, 'name': 'Edmond Kotowski', 'email': 'ekotowski@gmail.com', 'username': 'ekotowski'}, {'_account_id': 14576, 'name': 'Petr Malik', 'email': 'pmalik@tesora.com', 'username': 'pmalik'}, {'_account_id': 14829, 'name': 'Ashleigh Farnham', 'username': 'ashleighfarnham', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 15090, 'name': 'Elvis Teixeira', 'email': 'elvis.teixeira@lsbd.ufc.br', 'username': 'ElvisTeixeira'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-20 22:10:40.000000000', 'files': ['etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf.sample'], 'message': "Do not use '/tmp' as default guestagent log location

The Problem:
Redstack sets 'GUEST_LOGDIR' to the 'log_dir' value from
'etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf.sample' which happens to be '/tmp/'.

Aside from not being the canonical log file destination,
temporary directory in Linux is a subject to the, so called,
'restricted deletion' policy which dictates that only file owners
(and the directory owner) can delete the files, irrespective of
other access modifiers on the directory.

Redstack changes the owner of 'GUEST_LOGDIR' (default='/tmp')
to the 'trove' user. This may easily mask any potential issues with
the 'restricted deletion' that would only show up later on
production systems where '/tmp' is commonly owned by the root
(see bug/1423759).

The Solution:
Change the default value of 'log_dir' to a directory
which is not subject to the 'restricted deletion'.
Chose '/var/log/trove/' as it is a common place for
trove-related log files on the guestagent.

Change-Id: I39d801a7e19f329c129a0c6df0c3987049d16394
Closes-Bug: 1423760
Related-Bug: 1423759
Depends-On: I9dd6ed543a01ecc4f84065ea4bf3737960de6e24
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use '/tmp' as default guestagent log location

The Problem:
Redstack sets 'GUEST_LOGDIR' to the 'log_dir' value from
'etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf.sample' which happens to be '/tmp/'.

Aside from not being the canonical log file destination,
temporary directory in Linux is a subject to the, so called,
'restricted deletion' policy which dictates that only file owners
(and the directory owner) can delete the files, irrespective of
other access modifiers on the directory.

Redstack changes the owner of 'GUEST_LOGDIR' (default='/tmp')
to the 'trove' user. This may easily mask any potential issues with
the 'restricted deletion' that would only show up later on
production systems where '/tmp' is commonly owned by the root
(see bug/1423759).

The Solution:
Change the default value of 'log_dir' to a directory
which is not subject to the 'restricted deletion'.
Chose '/var/log/trove/' as it is a common place for
trove-related log files on the guestagent.

Change-Id: I39d801a7e19f329c129a0c6df0c3987049d16394
Closes-Bug: 1423760
Related-Bug: 1423759
Depends-On: I9dd6ed543a01ecc4f84065ea4bf3737960de6e24

commit_message:
V2.1 cleanup: Use concrete NotFound exception instead of generic

V2.1 API use decorator expected_error protect we haven't any
unexpected exception raise out. So we should use concrete exception
instead of generic exception. This patch uses concrete NotFound
exception instead of the generic exception NotFound.

Change-Id: I13a04bdc78b92de69b81333eeb529cadc4d3c856

commit_message:
Refactoring the rest tests and their tooling

There will be a need for session and role information in these
test as the code and tests get more complicated. I don't feel,
at this point, there is a need for a new test case class for these
tests.

Also, the utils in the api_tests directory is really
confusing. So, rolled that into the base test class in helpers.py

Change-Id: I1f1054d963101298d9e4f3e0b9c6f8df0d29227d

commit_message:
add pretty_tox to nova functional tests

debugging tests is a lot easier when you can actually inject stderr
directly through even on successes. Add the pretty tox facility from
nova / tempest-lib into python-nova client as well for functional
tests.

commit_message:
HP 3PAR driver fix for delete snapshot

Attempting to delete a CIFS snapshot raises an AttributeError
when attempting to split "shareDir" during dependent share
checking.  The split was made safe for an empty shareDir and
the path indexing was fixed in the dependent share checking.

Change-Id: Ieb745df6222817f6c459f62bac3fb66ecc576482
Closes-Bug: #1420055

commit_message:
Restart 'statsenderd' after changing Collector IP

In order to use test Collector instance while sending
usage stats during system tests we need to restart
'statsenderd' daemon after changing settings.

subject: Display app_uri in app show/create responses
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1375, 'name': 'Ed Cranford', 'email': 'ed.cranford@gmail.com', 'username': 'ed--cranford'}, {'_account_id': 2506, 'name': 'devdatta-kulkarni', 'email': 'kulkarni.devdatta@gmail.com', 'username': 'devdatta-kulkarni'}, {'_account_id': 6662, 'name': 'James Li', 'email': 'yueli.m@gmail.com', 'username': 'james-li-3'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-25 18:20:18.000000000', 'files': ['solumclient/solum.py'], 'message': "Display app_uri in app show/create responses

For now the only way to find out the URI of your
deployed assembly is to ask the assembly itself;
users interacting with Solum solely through the
'app' commands lack this important information.

Lacking the information in the plan resource, the
client searches through all the READY assemblies
built using that app ('plan') and adds the app_uri
of the most recently updated assembly to the response
of an app create or show command.

Change-Id: I5804a8002c311d714cc4cd94552635ebec5c5df8
"}]
commit_message:
Display app_uri in app show/create responses

For now the only way to find out the URI of your
deployed assembly is to ask the assembly itself;
users interacting with Solum solely through the
'app' commands lack this important information.

Lacking the information in the plan resource, the
client searches through all the READY assemblies
built using that app ('plan') and adds the app_uri
of the most recently updated assembly to the response
of an app create or show command.

Change-Id: I5804a8002c311d714cc4cd94552635ebec5c5df8

any new libraries that aren't in g-r as a result.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-21 19:37:59.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/manila.yaml'], 'message': "Set ERROR_ON_CLONE=False for Manila jobs

Manila is going to start using devstack plugin [1] instead of 'extras.d hooks'
approach. Devstack plugin clones project's repo and this
operation requires global env var 'ERROR_ON_CLONE' to be set to 'False',
which is set to 'True' by script devstack-vm-gate.sh, so, redefine it.
[1] I28eff33fc65aa741d9270d8bcb263a7fccd9baa4

Change-Id: Ib1e701f6e7ef2e5fa2b2b497d98cbe1e7e77cad9
"}]
commit_message:
Set ERROR_ON_CLONE=False for Manila jobs

Manila is going to start using devstack plugin [1] instead of 'extras.d hooks'
approach. Devstack plugin clones project's repo and this
operation requires global env var 'ERROR_ON_CLONE' to be set to 'False',
which is set to 'True' by script devstack-vm-gate.sh, so, redefine it.
[1] I28eff33fc65aa741d9270d8bcb263a7fccd9baa4

Change-Id: Ib1e701f6e7ef2e5fa2b2b497d98cbe1e7e77cad9

commit_message:
reorganise architecture page

- move historical and overview info into it's own page
- reorganise text to group by action and match general data flow
    - gathering data
    - processing data
    - storing data
    - accessing data
    - evaluating data
- move stevedore plugin into contributing section
- remove some minor duplicate or generic operations text
- removed item regarding push agents as we don't have it anymore,
  it was deemed too hacky, and would break often

Change-Id: Ica3f79d69dd091ccb5540361354ea65392ba7bf4

commit_message:
Add support of external Devstack plugin for Manila

Currently Manila uses 'extras.d hooks' approach of Devstack.
Add support of 'external devstack plugin' approach for CI jobs, to be able
to switch Manila's jobs for usage of new approach and remove hooks.

Change-Id: I473b6fdbb439c0a50b226f5d6a31a068a3159c1a

commit_message:
Rename functional files to projects.

Generally this area of the repo is organized by project, so rename
the *-functional.yaml files to avoid the suggestion that each job
needs its own file.  Instead, name them for their projects to suggest
that you can look in each project file to see the jobs that apply
specifically to that project.

Change-Id: I31e95a405c03c207e26f9a63403e1b7205595b7f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-06-02 21:05:52.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh', 'functions.sh'], 'message': 'Allow to configure git base URL

Makes the devstack-gate usable with a generic git repo.

git.openstack.org is hard-coded in functions.sh. Make it
configurable via GIT_BASE. Set defaults in functions.sh
just in case there is a consumer of functions.sh other than
devstack-gate-gate-wrap.sh.

Define GIT_BASE in devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh which
defaults to git.openstack.org, so that it can be set
via JJB changes only (layout.yaml).

The name of the "trunk" branch where devstack-gate is
fecthed from, and where grenade gets the latest code from,
is hard-coded to "master.

Define GIT_BRANCH in devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh which
defaults to master.

Change-Id: I59c1c63d6e8ac8482821728bf03bfce69898e919
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to configure git base URL

Makes the devstack-gate usable with a generic git repo.

git.openstack.org is hard-coded in functions.sh. Make it
configurable via GIT_BASE. Set defaults in functions.sh
just in case there is a consumer of functions.sh other than
devstack-gate-gate-wrap.sh.

Define GIT_BASE in devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh which
defaults to git.openstack.org, so that it can be set
via JJB changes only (layout.yaml).

The name of the "trunk" branch where devstack-gate is
fecthed from, and where grenade gets the latest code from,
is hard-coded to "master.

Define GIT_BRANCH in devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh which
defaults to master.

Change-Id: I59c1c63d6e8ac8482821728bf03bfce69898e919

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2889, 'name': 'Aeva Black', 'email': 'aeva.online@gmail.com', 'username': 'tenbrae'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 14760, 'name': 'John L. Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-24 14:50:52.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "For flake8 check, make the 'E12' ignore be more granular

ignore = E12 means ignore E12* errors.

Make it more granular by converting to E121,E122,...,E129

This will make it easier in the future to remove a single ignore and
update the code to resolve the issues.

Change-Id: I88adc53ce78db22f8fe9bcaa0885afef592150e9
"}]
commit_message:
For flake8 check, make the 'E12' ignore be more granular

ignore = E12 means ignore E12* errors.

Make it more granular by converting to E121,E122,...,E129

This will make it easier in the future to remove a single ignore and
update the code to resolve the issues.

Change-Id: I88adc53ce78db22f8fe9bcaa0885afef592150e9

commit_message:
Include operator created LPs when listing LPs

The languagepack list command should show

- Custom languagepacks created by the user, and
- All the languagepacks created by the operator.

This is the first step towards languagepack reusability.

Change-Id: I37db49e1ad1c2306dc91bf11e4cb8ccdbd08e3f3
Closes-bug: 1424861

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-25 18:29:41.000000000', 'files': ['mkdocs.yml', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/http_check.py', 'monasca_agent/common/emitter.py', 'conf.d/disk.yaml', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks/collector.py', 'monasca_setup/detection/plugins/network.py', 'monasca_setup/main.py', 'conf.d/memory.yaml', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks/services_checks.py', 'conf.d/load.yaml', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/disk.py', 'monasca_agent/common/util.py', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/load.py', 'monasca_agent/collector/daemon.py', 'agent.conf.template', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/cpu.py', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/nagios_wrapper.py', 'monasca_setup/detection/plugins/system.py', 'conf.d/cpu.yaml', 'monasca_agent/common/keystone.py', 'monasca_setup/detection/plugins/libvirt.py', 'README.md', 'monasca_setup/detection/plugins/__init__.py', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/network.py', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/kafka_consumer.py', 'conf.d/network.yaml', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/memory.py', 'monasca_agent/common/config.py', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks/system/unix.py', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/libvirt.py', 'monasca_agent/collector/checks/check.py'], 'message': 'Removing subprocess call from system metrics classes

Changed the IO, Disk and Network classes to not use a subprocess.
They now use psutil to get the metrics.  Also, changed the linux
system metrics classes to subclass the AgentCheck class instead
of the old-style Check class.  Added additional configuration
and changed monasca-setup to support that. Fixed some Python
2.6 incompatible string formatting issues.

Change-Id: I1f8b65bf48e48e2c598aa4950c194fbae2f9e337
'}]
commit_message:
Removing subprocess call from system metrics classes

Changed the IO, Disk and Network classes to not use a subprocess.
They now use psutil to get the metrics.  Also, changed the linux
system metrics classes to subclass the AgentCheck class instead
of the old-style Check class.  Added additional configuration
and changed monasca-setup to support that. Fixed some Python
2.6 incompatible string formatting issues.

Change-Id: I1f8b65bf48e48e2c598aa4950c194fbae2f9e337

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-12-30 03:59:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fake_libvirt_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_utils.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: clean instance's directory when block migration fails

In method pre_live_migration, we create instance's directory at destination
host during block live migration. If some exceptions happen before creating
domain succesfully like failure of connecting volume to destination host,
then we can't destroy instance in method rollback_live_migration_at_destination.
In this case we don't remove the instance's directory, this will lead an
DestinationDiskExists when live migration same instance to same destination.
This commit ensure the instance's directory is always cleaned at destination
host. This commit also extracts instance path calculation into a utility function.

Closes-Bug: #1392947
Change-Id: If86e73b07f17d28078ee48983e9e92aafb30d913
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: clean instance's directory when block migration fails

In method pre_live_migration, we create instance's directory at destination
host during block live migration. If some exceptions happen before creating
domain succesfully like failure of connecting volume to destination host,
then we can't destroy instance in method rollback_live_migration_at_destination.
In this case we don't remove the instance's directory, this will lead an
DestinationDiskExists when live migration same instance to same destination.
This commit ensure the instance's directory is always cleaned at destination
host. This commit also extracts instance path calculation into a utility function.

Closes-Bug: #1392947
Change-Id: If86e73b07f17d28078ee48983e9e92aafb30d913

commit_message:
Drop unnecessary sections from federation docs

There's no need for sections ``Request a local token with Service
Catalog extended with service providers`` and ``Get service catalog
extended with service providers`` since now it's just the same as
the base v3 identity API and isn't changed by the federation extension.

Change-Id: I355c26d6e231924fe7b0207321484b0e344bbdd3
Partially-Implements: bp k2k-service-providers

commit_message:
Ensure DNSPython modules are imported correctly

eventlet had previously triggered these imports from their code,
makeing the modules available to us for use.

Now that eventlet no longer does this, we need to explicitly
import the modules we use.

Closes-Bug: 1425616
Change-Id: I104e9eb399c5b3dd100254fc9c68824ba9dd8ec0

commit_message:
Fix in l2gateway agent scheduler logic.

agent scheduler should wait for agent_down_time
but not (2*agent_down_time) to decide whether an
agent is active or not.

Change-Id: I3f1047a3b60b4646aa7c5e6393881387a4e9e368

commit_message:
Move deployment handle_signal to rpc call

This allows deployments which haven't been created by a heat
resource to be signalled, which is required for
blueprint software-config-trigger.

This was reverted due to tripleo regression bug #1423126.
Calling timeutils.normalize_time before saving the date should
prevent the database error which caused the regression.

Partial-Blueprint: software-config-trigger

Change-Id: I6038090ef1e9aff5908dd21e08ba403748f10424

commit_message:
Drop deprecated namespace for oslo.rootwrap

The oslo team is recommending everyone to switch to the
non-namespaced versions of libraries.[1]
oslo.rootwrap suggests to use oslo_rootwrap.cmd:main.[2]

[1]https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/drop-namespace-packages
[2]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.rootwrap#using
Change-Id: I2e9b72c77316c8d097e7e49ab09fcb18ac33078c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7585, 'name': 'Ladislav Smola', 'email': 'lsmola@redhat.com', 'username': 'lsmola'}, {'_account_id': 7623, 'name': 'Erwan Velu', 'email': 'erwan@enovance.com', 'username': 'erwan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-24 09:22:17.000000000', 'files': ['etc/os-net-config/samples/mapping.yaml', 'os_net_config/tests/base.py', 'os_net_config/tests/test_objects.py', 'etc/os-net-config/samples/bond_mapped.yaml', 'os_net_config/objects.py', 'os_net_config/cli.py'], 'message': "Add mapping option to influence nicN mapping order

Currently there's a fixed mapping between abstracted interface
names (nic1, nic2 etc) and the underlying biosdevname for the
device.

In many cases, this mapping based on system enumeration is
sufficient, but in some cases, particularly when you perform
detailed pre-deployment discovery of interfaces, you may wish
to alter the mapping independently of the config (e.g if the
config is in a heat template, and the discovery data is
provided at runtime).

So this adds a -m option to os-net-config, which enables a
mapping file to be provided, such that specific interfaces
may be mapped to their abstract names based on knowledge of
the devices or the networks they are connected to.

The mapping file has the following format, where em1 and em2 are
device names as detected by the OS (e.g biosdevname):

interface_mapping:
    nic1: em2
    nic2: em1

Or you can use the device MAC instead:

interface_mapping:
    nic1: 12:34:56:78:9a:bc
    nic2: 12:34:56:de:f0:12

Change-Id: I93e6d3ed733244834bb3c2126c91db705b4d9167
"}]
commit_message:
Add mapping option to influence nicN mapping order

Currently there's a fixed mapping between abstracted interface
names (nic1, nic2 etc) and the underlying biosdevname for the
device.

In many cases, this mapping based on system enumeration is
sufficient, but in some cases, particularly when you perform
detailed pre-deployment discovery of interfaces, you may wish
to alter the mapping independently of the config (e.g if the
config is in a heat template, and the discovery data is
provided at runtime).

So this adds a -m option to os-net-config, which enables a
mapping file to be provided, such that specific interfaces
may be mapped to their abstract names based on knowledge of
the devices or the networks they are connected to.

The mapping file has the following format, where em1 and em2 are
device names as detected by the OS (e.g biosdevname):

interface_mapping:
    nic1: em2
    nic2: em1

Or you can use the device MAC instead:

interface_mapping:
    nic1: 12:34:56:78:9a:bc
    nic2: 12:34:56:de:f0:12

Change-Id: I93e6d3ed733244834bb3c2126c91db705b4d9167

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-04 15:36:32.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/manager.py'], 'message': 'Add sec-grp-rule for ipv6-icmp to enable ping6 between instances

The tempest testcase test_network_v6 checks if an ipv6 ping
between instance is possible. But therefore no security-group-
rule is being set up, to allow such a ping. The test fails.

This issue does not apply to a test that runs with the cirros
image, as cirros does not have ipv6 utils installed. There is
a if clause in the testcase, that skips this ping if the util
ping6 is not available.

Change-Id: Ia3fbe771cde8893e9eb3fc43b187435bd0dd1dbf
Closes-Bug: #1417584
'}]
commit_message:
Add sec-grp-rule for ipv6-icmp to enable ping6 between instances

The tempest testcase test_network_v6 checks if an ipv6 ping
between instance is possible. But therefore no security-group-
rule is being set up, to allow such a ping. The test fails.

This issue does not apply to a test that runs with the cirros
image, as cirros does not have ipv6 utils installed. There is
a if clause in the testcase, that skips this ping if the util
ping6 is not available.

Change-Id: Ia3fbe771cde8893e9eb3fc43b187435bd0dd1dbf
Closes-Bug: #1417584

subject: Fix db sync relationships
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7155, 'name': 'Sebastien Badia', 'email': 'seb@sebian.fr', 'username': 'sbadia'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-25 16:05:36.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/db/sync.pp', 'manifests/api.pp', 'spec/classes/gnocchi_api_spec.rb'], 'message': "Fix db sync relationships

The gnocchi puppet module doesn't specify a 'gnocchi' package (or
title), the package declaration is managed by generic_service define,
and the package title is generated using service name (eg. 'api') and
the prefix 'gnocchi-', so let's switch to 'gnocchi-api' for package
dependency.

The gnocchi puppet module doesn't specify a 'gnocchi' user, let's remove
this relationship.

And finally this patch fix the relationship about 'database/connection'
in order to use Gnocchi_config instead of Keystone_config.

This patch also remove deprecated [database]/sql_* group names.

Change-Id: I25b86efd5d0253d4528d2de5cec9cb498de82502
"}]
commit_message:
Fix db sync relationships

The gnocchi puppet module doesn't specify a 'gnocchi' package (or
title), the package declaration is managed by generic_service define,
and the package title is generated using service name (eg. 'api') and
the prefix 'gnocchi-', so let's switch to 'gnocchi-api' for package
dependency.

The gnocchi puppet module doesn't specify a 'gnocchi' user, let's remove
this relationship.

And finally this patch fix the relationship about 'database/connection'
in order to use Gnocchi_config instead of Keystone_config.

This patch also remove deprecated [database]/sql_* group names.

Change-Id: I25b86efd5d0253d4528d2de5cec9cb498de82502

commit_message:
Increasing devstack gate timeout for glusterfs experimental job

As tempest-dsvm-full-glusterfs-centos7 job talking more than 120
minutes, this patch increases the gate timeout to 180 minutes to
avoid timeout failures.

Change-Id: I2ceb7e798900b7354e339b10c47e688c229758e2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 1923, 'name': 'Mohammad Banikazemi', 'email': 'mbanikazemi@gmail.com', 'username': 'mb-s'}, {'_account_id': 2035, 'name': 'Maru Newby', 'email': 'marun@redhat.com', 'username': 'maru'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 5127, 'name': 'Justin Hammond', 'email': 'runningempty@gmail.com', 'username': 'justin-hammond'}, {'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 7924, 'name': 'Jason Meridth', 'email': 'jmeridth@gmail.com', 'username': 'jmeridth'}, {'_account_id': 8257, 'name': 'Brian Curtin', 'email': 'brian@python.org', 'username': 'briancurtin'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-02-24 20:58:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/common/extension.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'neutronclient/v2_0/client.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_client_extension.py', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/contrib/_fox_sockets.py', 'neutronclient/shell.py', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/contrib/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Client command extension support

Adds extension support with emphasis on ease of extension creation. Extensions
strongly conform to preexisting neutron commands (/neutron/v2_0/*). A sample
extension has been included (/neutron/v2_0/contrib/_fox_sockets.py). As it is
assumed that the sample extension will be packaged with the client, small
changes were required to include it with the unit tests.

It is also possible to install a module with a 'neutronclient.extension' entry-
point defined. More information on this can be found in the stevedore docs
under the section "Loading the Plugins". Extension discovery is modeled after
nova's module discovery but deviates strongly beyond that.

A conforming module, at a minimum:
* Will have a class that subclasses NeutronClientExtension to provide the
  requisite version support, paths, and variable names for the client.
  Example: neutronclient.neutron.v2_0.contrib._fox_sockets.FoxInSocket
* Will have at least one class that subclasses from the ClientExtension*
  classes to provide the new functionality to the client
  Example: neutronclient.neutron.v2_0.contrib._fox_sockets.FoxInSocketsList
* ClientExtension* subclasses must have a shell_command class variable if the
  command is to be available to the CLI (shell.py)
  Example: neutronclient.neutron.v2_0.contrib._fox_sockets.FoxInSocketsList

Provides client command extensions through new classes: NeutronClientExtension,
and ClientExtension<Action>.
The precedence of command loading are as follows:
* hard coded commands are loaded first
* contribued commands (those in /contrib)
* external commands (installed in the environment) are loaded last

Commands that have the same name will be overwritten by commands that are
loaded later. To greatly change the execution of a command for your particular
extension you only need to override the execute method.

Currently this extension support is limited to top-level resources. Parent/
child relationships may be added if desired.

Change-Id: I5b2fe530c90b5ce1243fc10341d6d434a1ecea7a
Implements: blueprint extensible-neutronclient
'}]
commit_message:
Client command extension support

Adds extension support with emphasis on ease of extension creation. Extensions
strongly conform to preexisting neutron commands (/neutron/v2_0/*). A sample
extension has been included (/neutron/v2_0/contrib/_fox_sockets.py). As it is
assumed that the sample extension will be packaged with the client, small
changes were required to include it with the unit tests.

It is also possible to install a module with a 'neutronclient.extension' entry-
point defined. More information on this can be found in the stevedore docs
under the section "Loading the Plugins". Extension discovery is modeled after
nova's module discovery but deviates strongly beyond that.

A conforming module, at a minimum:
* Will have a class that subclasses NeutronClientExtension to provide the
  requisite version support, paths, and variable names for the client.
  Example: neutronclient.neutron.v2_0.contrib._fox_sockets.FoxInSocket
* Will have at least one class that subclasses from the ClientExtension*
  classes to provide the new functionality to the client
  Example: neutronclient.neutron.v2_0.contrib._fox_sockets.FoxInSocketsList
* ClientExtension* subclasses must have a shell_command class variable if the
  command is to be available to the CLI (shell.py)
  Example: neutronclient.neutron.v2_0.contrib._fox_sockets.FoxInSocketsList

Provides client command extensions through new classes: NeutronClientExtension,
and ClientExtension<Action>.
The precedence of command loading are as follows:
* hard coded commands are loaded first
* contribued commands (those in /contrib)
* external commands (installed in the environment) are loaded last

Commands that have the same name will be overwritten by commands that are
loaded later. To greatly change the execution of a command for your particular
extension you only need to override the execute method.

Currently this extension support is limited to top-level resources. Parent/
child relationships may be added if desired.

Change-Id: I5b2fe530c90b5ce1243fc10341d6d434a1ecea7a
Implements: blueprint extensible-neutronclient

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-14 05:29:45.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate-wrap.sh'], 'message': "Allow PROJECTS to be overridden

Updating the default set of project repositories at the start of each
dsvm job adds 3-5m to the job's runtime.  For jobs that target only a
small subset of those repos, that overhead is largely unnecessary.  To
minimize the overhead of workspace setup, this change allows the
target project repositories (PROJECTS) to be overridden on a per-job

commit_message:
Allow PROJECTS to be overridden

Updating the default set of project repositories at the start of each
dsvm job adds 3-5m to the job's runtime.  For jobs that target only a
small subset of those repos, that overhead is largely unnecessary.  To
minimize the overhead of workspace setup, this change allows the
target project repositories (PROJECTS) to be overridden on a per-job
basis via the DEVSTACK_GATE_PROJECTS_OVERRIDE variable.

Change-Id: I0fb1bef66d82acdddeb9b29956fdd4311ea1f277

Skip also test fixtures when the entire class is skipped

If the entire class is skipped (service missing, bug, etc) then
it is pointless to execute test fixtures.

commit_message:
Fix IPMI support documentation

The docs incorrectly stated that the 'notification_driver' setting
belongs to the 'conductor' section of 'ironic.conf'. Corrected the
docs so that it's clear that should go to the 'DEFAULT' section.

Change-Id: I4321669af7fd3528e6703b56201a9ca12ba297c8

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-24 14:19:54.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/gabbi/gabbits/alarms.yaml'], 'message': "Initial gabbi testing for alarms

Initial testing of the alarms-related resources in the API. Note that
these tests were initially started by processing the WADL files at
https://github.com/openstack/api-site/tree/master/api-ref/src/wadls
to generate a stubbed out YAML file which was then filled in and
reordered as required. It doesn't save a great deal of time but does
provide a base to start from, which is useful scaffolding to get
started.

Thus, the endpoints in the YAML file are only those endpoints
mentioned in the WADL. If the documentation is not up to date, then
neither are these tests.

The course of these tests is as follows:

* list the alarms confirm there are none
* create an alarm
* list the alarms confirm there are one
* update an alarm
* check an alarm's history
* change state on alarm
* check the state
* delete the alarm
* list the alarms confirm there are none

This is not sufficient for coverage but does provide a good
representation of what's going on in the alarms API.

Tests with 'xfail: true' will require changes either in frameworks or
controllers, pending discussion.

Change-Id: I814b65abb753c4882b0aed48f0b20d6994fb1f30
"}]
commit_message:
Initial gabbi testing for alarms

Initial testing of the alarms-related resources in the API. Note that
these tests were initially started by processing the WADL files at
https://github.com/openstack/api-site/tree/master/api-ref/src/wadls
to generate a stubbed out YAML file which was then filled in and
reordered as required. It doesn't save a great deal of time but does
provide a base to start from, which is useful scaffolding to get
started.

Thus, the endpoints in the YAML file are only those endpoints
mentioned in the WADL. If the documentation is not up to date, then
neither are these tests.

The course of these tests is as follows:

* list the alarms confirm there are none
* create an alarm
* list the alarms confirm there are one
* update an alarm
* check an alarm's history
* change state on alarm
* check the state
* delete the alarm
* list the alarms confirm there are none

This is not sufficient for coverage but does provide a good
representation of what's going on in the alarms API.

Tests with 'xfail: true' will require changes either in frameworks or
controllers, pending discussion.

Change-Id: I814b65abb753c4882b0aed48f0b20d6994fb1f30

commit_message:
Revert "Change messaging clients to return one value and update tests"

This change broke Zaqar's gate. Please, lets revert it and re-try adding
it with a proper fix. I believe the issue is that it expects to receive
a dictionary everytime, whereas some of Zaqar's responses are lists.

Please see this review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/151529/6 (mongodb job)

This reverts commit 4b51340639a5b5f876fdc29c494bccf4a6dc5b6a.

Change-Id: Ie89c988b2a06b557238f9a15616bb4a8bb5b2a17

commit_message:
Root partition should be bootable for localboot

When instance are booted with 'boot_option' as 'local', Ironic
installs boot loader (that is present within the image) and then
makes the machine to boot from disk. This will fail on some BIOS
if the root partition is not marked as bootable.  This commit marks
root partition as bootable when boot_option is 'local'.

Change-Id: Ic88b4dda2d73be54fde5046f85356aba641a0fbe
Closes-Bug: 1422721

commit_message:
Synchronising oslo-incubator service module

Importing service module and its dependencies to enable
openstack common service launcher within glance. This will
be used as the framework for event notifiers and listeners.

This change is a pre-requisite for blueprint
catalog-index-service implementation

All imported modules are new and shouldn't impact any of
the existing glance functionality.

Closes-Bug: #1413861
Partially Implements: blueprint catalog-index-service

commit_message:
Revert "Disable voting on pylint because of novaclient breakage"

Change If9c55446c4d10a58e9723f5c333082bcacb431b8 merged and
healed the job. This should be voting again, so that we
prevent other issues from sneaking in.

Reverting commit eff14a1bf1f21758211946523d9c069dd8467d34 does
the trick.

commit_message:
Add new trove xmldocs job

Consolidate docs job.

We need two jobs since trove has sphinx documentation and XML docbook,
and both need to be reviewed. So, merge all voting XML docbook jobs into
the checkbuild job.

Run the checkbuild and checklinks job only if the change touches the
apidocs directory.

Change-Id: I1de35e482e3fcf799bf5979dbb8fb235ddd35e42
Depends-On: I3432ddaee4c79fbe395a5c76f2b192cfc2f01e24

commit_message:
Fixes issue with missing pinned package

The package "libvirt-bin=1.2.2-0ubuntu13.1.8" was pulled from the upstream
ubuntu archive and has since been pulled from the rackspace ubuntu mirror
because this package no longer exists we must rev our pinned version of
it the lastest stable release. The new version of this package is now
"libvirt-bin=1.2.2-0ubuntu13.1.9"

Change-Id: Iff262483cb2684b5c4341eabcbdf39aa65ee94f5
Closes-Bug: #1425139

subject: Add port configuration in plan data model
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1375, 'name': 'Ed Cranford', 'email': 'ed.cranford@gmail.com', 'username': 'ed--cranford'}, {'_account_id': 2506, 'name': 'devdatta-kulkarni', 'email': 'kulkarni.devdatta@gmail.com', 'username': 'devdatta-kulkarni'}, {'_account_id': 6662, 'name': 'James Li', 'email': 'yueli.m@gmail.com', 'username': 'james-li-3'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-24 20:29:40.000000000', 'files': ['solum/api/controllers/v1/datamodel/plan.py', 'examples/plans/tomcat.yaml', 'examples/plans/py.yaml', 'solum/api/handlers/plan_handler.py', 'solum/api/controllers/v1/datamodel/types.py'], 'message': 'Add port configuration in plan data model

User can define ‘ports’ in plan file, if not found the default
value of 80 is used. The patch provides three ways to define ports:

1. Single integer, e.g. ports: 5000

2. A list of integers, e.g. ports: [8080, 8081]

3. A dictionary, e.g. ports: {‘API_PORT’: 9292, ‘REG_PORT’: 9191}.
In this case the ports variables will override the configurations
defined in user parameters.

Closes-bug: #1425266
Change-Id: I6faafb460e4e73fa1d03d1bf025e9e6dece15be7
'}]
commit_message:
Add port configuration in plan data model

User can define ‘ports’ in plan file, if not found the default
value of 80 is used. The patch provides three ways to define ports:

1. Single integer, e.g. ports: 5000

2. A list of integers, e.g. ports: [8080, 8081]

3. A dictionary, e.g. ports: {‘API_PORT’: 9292, ‘REG_PORT’: 9191}.
In this case the ports variables will override the configurations
defined in user parameters.

Closes-bug: #1425266
Change-Id: I6faafb460e4e73fa1d03d1bf025e9e6dece15be7

subject: Make DBAPI class work with mocks correctly
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 14:02:28.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/api.py', 'oslo_db/tests/test_api.py'], 'message': "Make DBAPI class work with mocks correctly

Currently, DBAPI __getattr__() implementation will *always*
implicitly wrap all mocked methods of a target class/module using
wrap_db_retry(), as retry_on_* attributes will always exist and be
true for mock instances. Not only this leads to a situation, when
we would retry methods, we were not going to retry, but this also
fails with AttributeError on functools.wraps() call, breaking valid
unit tests in projects.

DBAPI is changed in a way, so that it does dict look ups instead of
fetching instance attributes to ensure mocked methods are handled
correctly and aren't wrapped when they shouldn't be wrapped.

Related issue:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22204660/python-mock-wrapsf-problems

Change-Id: I36550ffa88056c53a431d64e61e84fbb44bbf68d
"}]
commit_message:
Make DBAPI class work with mocks correctly

Currently, DBAPI __getattr__() implementation will *always*
implicitly wrap all mocked methods of a target class/module using
wrap_db_retry(), as retry_on_* attributes will always exist and be
true for mock instances. Not only this leads to a situation, when
we would retry methods, we were not going to retry, but this also
fails with AttributeError on functools.wraps() call, breaking valid
unit tests in projects.

DBAPI is changed in a way, so that it does dict look ups instead of
fetching instance attributes to ensure mocked methods are handled
correctly and aren't wrapped when they shouldn't be wrapped.

Related issue:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22204660/python-mock-wrapsf-problems

Change-Id: I36550ffa88056c53a431d64e61e84fbb44bbf68d

commit_message:
Add timeouts to murano-agent calls

Now there is no way to be sure that the agent successfully started execution
on a VM. Also there is no control of the execution time of scripts on agent.
This patch adds timeouts to agent`s calls on murano engine side

Implements blueprint murano-agent-timeouts
Change-Id: I81b1cf526e07be5ee32b51e259b93b6b40b122cf

commit_message:
Only use public_endpoint when specified

Default public_endpoint in keystone.conf to not be set, unless
specified. By default this value isn't required.

Change-Id: I5f5c213ef639f548b80080c5c5338db610b0b7f8
Closes-Bug: #1421048

commit_message:
Add support for 'latest' in microversion header

Allow a consumer of the REST API to specify a microversion
identifier of 'latest', indicating that they want the server to
respond with the latest supported version.

commit_message:
Allow subclasses to define the serialization namespaces

This allows the serialization and project namespaces to be overridden in
subclasses of VersionedObject. The project one should be set on each
using implementation, but the base serialization one is just there for
projects that already use this code and need it to be equal to what they
currently use.

Change-Id: Iecec043adc31441cc8865fa5e54d9a0ee4a5989a

commit_message:
Enables Swift backup driver for auth 2.0

This patch adds support for Swift auth 2.0 to the
 cinder-backup Swift driver.

I've noticed that the changes have been automatically
 made in the following sources:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/section_cinder.conf.html
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/cinder-conf-changes-juno.html
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/section_volume-misc.html

except for the one in this patch. The options had the
 category “swift” instead of “backups_swift”.
The category was fixed and the tables were regenerated
 and added to the patch.

Change-Id: I95dcee8e5fa1ac083d31c75f6ad78e75c468b433
Closes-Bug: #1355475

The setup for the neutron functional job does not invoke devstack
directly or via devstack-vm-gate.sh.  Instead, it manually calls
devstack functions to install and configure neutron's distro
dependencies.  This change adds a job that runs only that setup with
the hope of having devstack-gate and devstack eventually gate on it.
With no potentially racey tests being run, the job should only fail if
a change to either project will legitimately break the setup of the
neutron functional job.

Change-Id: Ie31dcc4e25afc07e64f74bb6b97bc6445572a959
Depends-On: I0fb1bef66d82acdddeb9b29956fdd4311ea1f277

commit_message:
Add job to target only neutron functional setup

The setup for the neutron functional job does not invoke devstack
directly or via devstack-vm-gate.sh.  Instead, it manually calls
devstack functions to install and configure neutron's distro
dependencies.  This change adds a job that runs only that setup with
the hope of having devstack-gate and devstack eventually gate on it.
With no potentially racey tests being run, the job should only fail if
a change to either project will legitimately break the setup of the
neutron functional job.

Change-Id: Ie31dcc4e25afc07e64f74bb6b97bc6445572a959
Depends-On: I0fb1bef66d82acdddeb9b29956fdd4311ea1f277

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11029, 'name': 'Jamie Finnigan', 'email': 'jamiefinnigan@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamiefinnigan'}, {'_account_id': 11861, 'name': 'Travis McPeak', 'email': 'tmcpeak@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'travis-mcpeak'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 14:14:33.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/core/constants.py'], 'message': "Add list of Python values considered False

The list of False values can be used by tests to check if
values are False or True more reliably. If a value is in
FALSE_VALUES it is false and otherwise is true. This will
only work in cases were the values being checked are
constants. This also does not deal with the case where a
user-defined class instance evaluates to false. We couldn't
figure that out anyway.

See https://docs.python.org/2/library/stdtypes.html#truth-value-testing

Change-Id: Ie301287c2516d311487dece0c098a36837f872dd
"}]
commit_message:
Add list of Python values considered False

The list of False values can be used by tests to check if
values are False or True more reliably. If a value is in
FALSE_VALUES it is false and otherwise is true. This will
only work in cases were the values being checked are
constants. This also does not deal with the case where a
user-defined class instance evaluates to false. We couldn't
figure that out anyway.

See https://docs.python.org/2/library/stdtypes.html#truth-value-testing

Change-Id: Ie301287c2516d311487dece0c098a36837f872dd

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11536, 'name': 'hongbin', 'email': 'hongbin034@gmail.com', 'username': 'hongbin'}, {'_account_id': 12385, 'name': 'Motohiro/Yuanying Otsuka', 'email': 'yuanying@fraction.jp', 'username': 'yuanying'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 08:41:47.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/common/rpc_service.py'], 'message': 'Register all magnum exceptions in allow_remote_exmods

Whenever any remote commands raise an exception,
that exception is returned as RemoteError to the
controller rather than being from the magnum
exceptions. Then controller further returns this
to user causing 500 InternalServerError status.
This was so because magnum exceptions were not
listed in allow_remote_exmods.

This patch registers all magnum exceptions in
allow_remote_exmods list. Thus helping to send
proper response to user.

Partially implements blueprint exception-handling-in-magnum
Closes bug: #1424904

Change-Id: Ia90b74798ac070ea514c66a4f66db939dbd1d2a9
'}]
commit_message:
Register all magnum exceptions in allow_remote_exmods

Whenever any remote commands raise an exception,
that exception is returned as RemoteError to the
controller rather than being from the magnum
exceptions. Then controller further returns this
to user causing 500 InternalServerError status.
This was so because magnum exceptions were not
listed in allow_remote_exmods.

This patch registers all magnum exceptions in
allow_remote_exmods list. Thus helping to send
proper response to user.

Partially implements blueprint exception-handling-in-magnum
Closes bug: #1424904

Change-Id: Ia90b74798ac070ea514c66a4f66db939dbd1d2a9

Add element for bare nodes

KeyError exceptions if there are nodes in the Ironic inventory
without these (specifically: cpus, memory_mb, local_gb).  This
updates the extension to avoid the KeyError. This is consistent
with how the Ironic driver calculates resources from nodes.  That
is, nodes that are missing a specific property are simply considered

commit_message:
Fix BM nodes extension to deal with missing node properties

The os-baremetal-nodes extension currently relies on the presence
of specific properties on the Ironic nodes.  This can result in
KeyError exceptions if there are nodes in the Ironic inventory
without these (specifically: cpus, memory_mb, local_gb).  This
updates the extension to avoid the KeyError. This is consistent
with how the Ironic driver calculates resources from nodes.  That
is, nodes that are missing a specific property are simply considered
to provide 0 resources of that type.

Change-Id: I1c30d5100b01a3e8cbce5185b5adeb8b5ce48aa0
Closes-Bug: #1423427

commit_message:
Remove Nova EC2 from HAProxy and STunnel

Nova EC2 is no longer used and should be removed from HAProxy and
stunnel. HAProxy reports the service is down which could be confusing to
anyone testing the overcloud. STunnel will leave its configured port
open even if there no service listening beneath.

Change-Id: I896cad9e4ee01bfbd7283cd7f3b5332d39fad2ca

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-11 19:10:42.000000000', 'files': ['generate-gitmodules', '.gitmodules'], 'message': 'Change scope from integrated gate to all of openstack

Instead of just tracking projects that are part of the integrated gate
lets start tracking all of openstack.

Defining openstack as everything in openstack/ openstack-infra/ and
openstack-dev/

As we move away from a single integrated gate, the list of what should
be in this repo under the old definition is quickly dropping. Instead of
using this to just help debug integrated gate failures, we can use this
to better track all openstack activity.

Knowing the basic nature of a gate failure means you can quickly narrow
down the number of repos that can possibly trigger the failure. That
combined with ElasticSearch data to identify a window of time the issue
was introduced during makes it easy to quickly narrow the number of
patches that could have possibly cause the problems.

Change-Id: I9c04a4d53f4628e0419d744b7e047ad75c0d133d
'}]
commit_message:
Change scope from integrated gate to all of openstack

Instead of just tracking projects that are part of the integrated gate
lets start tracking all of openstack.

Defining openstack as everything in openstack/ openstack-infra/ and
openstack-dev/

As we move away from a single integrated gate, the list of what should
be in this repo under the old definition is quickly dropping. Instead of
using this to just help debug integrated gate failures, we can use this
to better track all openstack activity.

Knowing the basic nature of a gate failure means you can quickly narrow
down the number of repos that can possibly trigger the failure. That
combined with ElasticSearch data to identify a window of time the issue
was introduced during makes it easy to quickly narrow the number of
patches that could have possibly cause the problems.

Change-Id: I9c04a4d53f4628e0419d744b7e047ad75c0d133d

commit_message:
Add keystone-session support

Currently python-manilaclient doesn't support keystone sessions
unlike to others clients. keystoneclient.session.Session gives
end-user possibility to share common authentication and request
parameters between a variety of services.

- Add python-keystoneclient to requirements.txt
- Move authentication logic to v1/client.py
- Move HttpClient to separate module
- Simplify SecretsHelper in shell.py
- Replace service_catalog module by keystoneclient.service_catalog
- Add appropriate unit tests

Implements bp add-keystone-session-support

Change-Id: I7d1c50fa31d9e2f32bb518a78a02bc12b114d0ab

commit_message:
Add ansible role for running puppet

Rather than embedding ansible roles inside of puppet modules (which is
mildly more than passing strange) make the ansible role a standalone
role that can be published to ansible galaxy.

Change-Id: I79a5a21278a1268e0e0011a874ff29c6980fd334

The 0.8.7 release of httpretty, which came out 2015-02-21, is causing

The issue appears to be related to

commit_message:
Avoid httpretty 0.8.7 release

The 0.8.7 release of httpretty, which came out 2015-02-21, is causing
python-openstacksdk's test suite to enter an infinite loop on py34 runs.
The issue appears to be related to
https://github.com/gabrielfalcao/HTTPretty/issues/221, which has a pull
request open at https://github.com/gabrielfalcao/HTTPretty/pull/193 (by
Dave Stanek).

Change-Id: I44d61a129bbf013621f6d19ca272da5156a2626e
Closes-Bug: 1424440

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-25 11:03:17.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/client.py'], 'message': "Release connection after consuming the content

When using stream=True, we need to make sure we release a connection
back to the connection pool to avoid warnings clogging up the logs. We
can do this by releasing the connection once we've read all the content
from the response. In situations where stream=False, requests already
does this for us.

Related-bug: 1424732
Closes-bug: 1341777
Change-Id: Id1c72ad86135a49d4b985992d788736b65f7dbda
"}]
commit_message:
Release connection after consuming the content

When using stream=True, we need to make sure we release a connection
back to the connection pool to avoid warnings clogging up the logs. We
can do this by releasing the connection once we've read all the content
from the response. In situations where stream=False, requests already
does this for us.

Related-bug: 1424732
Closes-bug: 1341777
Change-Id: Id1c72ad86135a49d4b985992d788736b65f7dbda

It sounds like MismatchError is borderline between part
of a public interface of testtools, and may or may not be
available depending of testtoools version.

Get rid of the nonsense altogether. The helper method was
wrong in that it shouldn't have been asserting a result if an
expected condition was not that. This commit removes the
broken helper method in favor of directly calling the

Change-Id: Iaa611f833f70a528f38fe8cc9d9add0047bf51e1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix AttributeError on testtools missing MismatchError

It sounds like MismatchError is borderline between part
of a public interface of testtools, and may or may not be
available depending of testtoools version.

Get rid of the nonsense altogether. The helper method was
wrong in that it shouldn't have been asserting a result if an
expected condition was not that. This commit removes the
broken helper method in favor of directly calling the 
get_dns_servers method where necessary.

Closes-bug: #1424482

Change-Id: Iaa611f833f70a528f38fe8cc9d9add0047bf51e1

commit_message:
Removed **kwargs for volume in create_and_attach_volume

**kwargs was used for both the volume and the server
creation which lead to the bug mentioned below. **kwargs should be used
for the server creation only in this scenario.

Change-Id: Ic234344749423a43458eb38cb6753b3b6b37f591
Closes-Bug: #1425149

commit_message:
Force add tag to the repository being tested

In projects where we add a testing version via git tag, force it to be added.
This ensures we don't fail if ZUUL_CHANGES contains duplicate projects.

Change-Id: Id2d33b7ad5168ef63e4ebb4e1a7f005b27077a45

commit_message:
add an option to disable non-metric meters

a large chunk of meters don't measure anything and are really
healthcheck events. these should be stored as events and not
samples. this patch adds an option to disable false meters and
warn if not disabled.

Change-Id: I654f657dd36967ad3ec99bbe06209e7745432e12

commit_message:
add missing objectstore entry points

the ceilometermiddleware notifications are missing entry points. this
patch adds them. it also breaks the endpoint in two: one to build
real meters and one to build the request event meter.

Change-Id: I75ba73c150c0d9fa282d0388fb7178e351511097
Closes-Bug: #1425303

commit_message:
Fix crash when stat'ing objects with non-ascii names

This patch fixes a crash and stack trace in stat when an object
name contains non-ascii characters.

Change-Id: Ib6dc686771e593243de56cafc100b17e51d9d9d5
Closes-Bug: 1411665

commit_message:
Don't launch stress cleanup in TempestContext

Built-in stress cleanup from Tempest looks like broken, also it
designed as way to shot yourself in the foot.

Change-Id: Ie6bfe4eb0d84947448457e6f6eb850fda6098084

commit_message:
Transfer tables

A widget to support Launch Instance workflow. Tables for allocating
flavors, networks, and others to an instance.

Mockup: http://invis.io/4Y27NZ3AH

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign
Change-Id: I1bd05b4ac7b8a59b18e16f7d5afce1fbe45902c0

Since we clearly don't know when to bump the minor number vs the patch
number. Set upper bound for clients to the currently installed versions.

Based on output of
http://logs.openstack.org/12/158012/3/check/check-tempest-dsvm-full-icehouse/09191e4/logs/pip-freeze.txt.gz

commit_message:
Adjust python-client caps to max at current version

Since we clearly don't know when to bump the minor number vs the patch
number. Set upper bound for clients to the currently installed versions.

Based on output of
http://logs.openstack.org/12/158012/3/check/check-tempest-dsvm-full-icehouse/09191e4/logs/pip-freeze.txt.gz

Change-Id: I180d5cd49c1ba96705ee85541cac19be5b6837ca

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-22 23:07:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/config.py', 'neutron/notifiers/nova.py'], 'message': 'Make nova notifier work with sessions

commit_message:
Make nova notifier work with sessions

This allows a variety of additional authentication methods and gives us
keystone V3 auth for free.

DocImpact: Deprecates the nova_admin_* config options in favour of
putting nova config options in the [nova] section.

Closes-Bug: #1403686
Change-Id: Ia9941cd3e85f21cbd4db9eb3cef8b200131af9ce

subject: Revert "Change from ML2 to monolithic plugin"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 10:49:18.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/todo.rst'], 'message': 'Revert "Change from ML2 to monolithic plugin"

This reverts commit 3fdb8768b78a0b75e8c7980badeb8d2365ec3686.

The referenced thread is still ongoing.  The choice doesn't seem so
obvious.  I'm tempted to just revert back to the original plan of
using ML2 to get to something that works as quickly as possible and
just converting to a monolithic plugin later if/when needed.

Change-Id: If095ad0cec6e43c2e6484320e7415fce2fc9140d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Change from ML2 to monolithic plugin"

This reverts commit 3fdb8768b78a0b75e8c7980badeb8d2365ec3686.

The referenced thread is still ongoing.  The choice doesn't seem so
obvious.  I'm tempted to just revert back to the original plan of
using ML2 to get to something that works as quickly as possible and
just converting to a monolithic plugin later if/when needed.

Change-Id: If095ad0cec6e43c2e6484320e7415fce2fc9140d

DEPLOYED status of sessions was not handled properly - the bug was
caused that if environment was deployed with failure it may remain with

'}]
commit_message:
Fixed logic of determining environment status

DEPLOYED status of sessions was not handled properly - the bug was
caused that if environment was deployed with failure it may remain with
this status even if it was deployed successfully after that.

Change-Id: I00309a7605067727eca4108e3fedac7bf0998847
Closes-Bug: #1413260

commit_message:
Add support for Trove Replication

Added initial support for replication.
Changed launch dialog to have an Advanced tab where
you can select a master instance for replication
Display replication information in details view
Added support for Detach

Change-Id: I2c90d5be0f47c07fe9049a685fbf7a36a2585e0e
Implements: blueprint trove-replication-v1-support

as others.

commit_message:
Add a (configurable) set of roles to users

When configured, all users are granted the configured roles within the
created projects. By default no roles are configured.

Add support for new task type 'reboot'.
It is apply only one parameters 'timeout' which mean -
how much time we should wait after sending reboot command
to detect fact of node restarting.

This change require to add new validation schema (v2).

DocImpact

Implements blueprint reboot-action-for-plugin

commit_message:
Reboot task type for plugins

Add support for new task type 'reboot'.
It is apply only one parameters 'timeout' which mean -
how much time we should wait after sending reboot command
to detect fact of node restarting.

This change require to add new validation schema (v2).

DocImpact

Implements blueprint reboot-action-for-plugin

Change-Id: I86be0f8baf72ef245ab489ddb9e7e1b1f9d2b605

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-24 19:52:09.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/utils.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/fc_cmode.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/prophetstor/dpl_iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/ibmnas.py', 'cinder/tests/test_storwize_svc.py', 'cinder/openstack/common/log.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/openvstorage.py', 'cinder/tests/test_openvstorage.py', 'cinder/tests/test_drbdmanagedrv.py', 'cinder/tests/scheduler/test_goodness_weigher.py', 'cinder/backup/drivers/swift.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/replication.py', 'cinder/tests/keymgr/test_key.py', 'cinder/tests/volume/drivers/netapp/test_common.py', 'cinder/tests/api/contrib/test_volume_replication.py'], 'message': 'pep8 E251 (keyword arguments and spaces) cleanup

E251 is "unexpected spaces around keyword / parameter equals".
It is format "f(param1 = 5, param2 = 3)" -> "f(param1=5, param2=3)".

As is reported in the related bug, running pep8 shows many errors in
the current cinder code. Reasonably, it is not expected that all of
them are fixed.

I think this pep8 recommendation is valid, because it increases
readability to know at a glance that a keyword argument is being used.

In this case, E251 currently has 192 occurrences.
This commit fixes most of them. There are still cases (45 remain) where
it is not possible to refactor the code just to comply with this, or
else the 80 character limit would be surpassed and it would decrease
readability.

Additionally, some module imports were moved to the top of their files
and 2 comparisons to None were changed to use "is" instead of == or !=.

In summary, the main change is that the E251 occurrences went from 192
to 45.

Change-Id: I52e4cd5e98145125b27e0fa725f735c50dcdb7a1
Partial-Bug: #1424613
'}]
commit_message:
pep8 E251 (keyword arguments and spaces) cleanup

E251 is "unexpected spaces around keyword / parameter equals".
It is format "f(param1 = 5, param2 = 3)" -> "f(param1=5, param2=3)".

As is reported in the related bug, running pep8 shows many errors in
the current cinder code. Reasonably, it is not expected that all of
them are fixed.

I think this pep8 recommendation is valid, because it increases
readability to know at a glance that a keyword argument is being used.

In this case, E251 currently has 192 occurrences.
This commit fixes most of them. There are still cases (45 remain) where
it is not possible to refactor the code just to comply with this, or
else the 80 character limit would be surpassed and it would decrease
readability.

Additionally, some module imports were moved to the top of their files
and 2 comparisons to None were changed to use "is" instead of == or !=.

In summary, the main change is that the E251 occurrences went from 192
to 45.

Change-Id: I52e4cd5e98145125b27e0fa725f735c50dcdb7a1
Partial-Bug: #1424613

commit_message:
Fixes issue with missing pinned package

The package "libvirt-bin=1.2.2-0ubuntu13.1.8" was pulled from the upstream
ubuntu archive and has since been pulled from the rackspace ubuntu mirror
because this package no longer exists we must rev our pinned version of
it the lastest stable release. The new version of this package is now
"libvirt-bin=1.2.2-0ubuntu13.1.9"

Change-Id: Iff262483cb2684b5c4341eabcbdf39aa65ee94f5
Closes-Bug: #1425139

subject: Fix rabbitmq OCF get_status for action monitor
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-24 11:21:18.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nova/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Fix rabbitmq OCF get_status for action monitor

W/o this fix, RabbitMQ app running under load
sometimes can hang with action status. This is a
problem because Pacemaker cannot detect the resource
failure and keeps RabbitMQ app unresponsive.

The solution is to wrap with a timeout the rabbitmqctl
eval command invoked by get_status() so it would be
killed, if hanged.

Change-Id: I2b16cced07dd8ee4888b5ed2d66934bc601a845d
Closes-bug: #1423116
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq OCF get_status for action monitor

W/o this fix, RabbitMQ app running under load
sometimes can hang with action status. This is a
problem because Pacemaker cannot detect the resource
failure and keeps RabbitMQ app unresponsive.

The solution is to wrap with a timeout the rabbitmqctl
eval command invoked by get_status() so it would be
killed, if hanged.

Change-Id: I2b16cced07dd8ee4888b5ed2d66934bc601a845d
Closes-bug: #1423116
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
