commit_message:
FCZM fix reading of cinder config entries

The zone manager and the lookup service had some cruft code that
was incorrectly reading the cinder.conf sections it needed.
When cinder.conf was configured to use the Cisco driver, the zone
manager would never see it, because it was reading from the wrong
section of cinder.conf.

Change-Id: I4a48bc39e55d4b7e9a149a3ec3aa3947980360ea
Closes-Bug: 1424852

commit_message:
Change template for networks created by libvirt

Change prefix for libvrit networks names which are
created by libvrirt driver for new environments.
This is needed to avoid conficts while using 2.5.x
and 2.9.x versions of fuel-devops on single server.

Change-Id: Ie7bddd72e6eca0d6629bf04d209c1716375c3dcb
Related-bug: #1422687

commit_message:
Customize devops DB backend settings

We have migrated to a new version of devops with changed default
DB settings.
To allow using environment prepared on the old devops for upgrade
tests, we need possibility to customize devops DB settings.

Change-Id: I5df9000212203dac3a4128effcc242ab8c45732f

commit_message:
Make compute unit tests inherit from test.NoDBTestCase

This patch changes the `compute` tests-package(where it's possible)
to test.NoDBTestCase saving test case running time.

- nova.tests.unit.compute.test_compute.CheckConfigDriveTestCase
  before : Ran 3 tests in 1.891s
  after : Ran 3 tests in 0.100s

- nova.tests.unit.compute.test_flavors.ExtraSpecTestCase
  before : Ran 3 tests in 1.842s
  after : Ran 3 tests in 0.113s

- nova.tests.unit.compute.test_resources.TestVCPU
  before : Ran 6 tests in 1.897s
  after : Ran 6 tests in 0.116s

- nova.tests.unit.compute.test_resources.BaseTestCase
  before : Ran 9 tests in 1.990s
  after : Ran 9 tests in 0.149s

- nova.tests.unit.compute.test_rpcapi.ComputeRpcAPITestCase
  before : Ran 76 tests in 3.941s
  after : Ran 76 tests in 0.796s

- nova.tests.unit.compute.monitors.test_cpu_monitor.\
      ComputeDriverCPUMonitorTestCase
  before : Ran 2 tests in 3.883s
  after : Ran 2 tests in 0.287s

- nova.tests.unit.compute.monitors.test_monitors.\
      ResourceMonitorBaseTestCase
  before : Ran 2 tests in 4.028s
  after : Ran 2 tests in 0.254s

- nova.tests.unit.compute.monitors.test_monitors.\
      ResourceMonitorsTestCase
  before : Ran 5 tests in 8.937s
  after : Ran 5 tests in 0.402s

Change-Id: I5b71b6360061261daf28037b8f293844cc352c6f

commit_message:
Implement Ceph Backend

Gnocchi has a Ceph backend.
This patch implements the configuration to use it.

Also fix puppet-lint for MySQL class.

commit_message:
Add additional network verification for nova subnets

Based on the review by Tatyana Leontovich:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130269/

If we split the fixed network into smallest ones, check that all
created subnets do not go beyond the nova fixed network and do not
intersect each other.

Change-Id: I9834fd958382e7a44d667f50d49d28e5bdc393f7
Implements: blueprint implement-regressive-tests-and-checks
Closes-Bug: #1381586

commit_message:
console: add unit tests for baseproxy

Commit 97d63d8745cd9b3b391ce96b94b4da263b3a053d introduced a TypeError
in baseproxy.

That's fixed in commit 4fe64143cb4ceafbfa8580a34cfa75d599d48151 but
while reviewing that change it was noticed that there is no unit test
coverage for the baseproxy module, so it's added here.

Related-Bug: #1424532

If resource is not changed during time period we have only
one record in DB. But in CSV time series report we should have
rows on each date for resource. For such case we are duplicating
not changed row in the CSV report. But we should remove from
resource data 'added', 'modified', 'removed' in case of duplication
of the resource row.
We are duplicating resource rows only until masternode had sent
stats. For indication of sending stat InstallationStructure creation_date
and modification_date are used.

Implements: blueprint openstack-workload-statistics
Change-Id: Ide21e17d5ebf8359fe2913a5458c9c8d499b8da5
"}]
commit_message:
Seamless CSV report

If resource is not changed during time period we have only
one record in DB. But in CSV time series report we should have
rows on each date for resource. For such case we are duplicating
not changed row in the CSV report. But we should remove from
resource data 'added', 'modified', 'removed' in case of duplication
of the resource row.
We are duplicating resource rows only until masternode had sent
stats. For indication of sending stat InstallationStructure creation_date
and modification_date are used.

Implements: blueprint openstack-workload-statistics
Change-Id: Ide21e17d5ebf8359fe2913a5458c9c8d499b8da5

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-02-24 14:26:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/network_util.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_network_util.py'], 'message': 'VMware: fix network connectivity problems

When using Neutron and there are hundreds of Neutron networks
defined there are cases when a VM that is deployed will not get
network connectivity. This is due to the fact that the network for
the VM in question are not sent in the first blob of data from the VC.
The VC will make use of a token indicating that there is additional
information.

The VC indicates that it has multiple results.

NOTE: Commit 1deb31f85a8f5d1e261b2cf1eddc537a5da7f60b removed the ESX
driver. The retrieval of networks only needs to be done for a cluster
and not a ESX host.

Closes-bug: #1375320

Change-Id: I7299c38410dedd20e3778db3c4f1a63d92b4334c
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: fix network connectivity problems

When using Neutron and there are hundreds of Neutron networks
defined there are cases when a VM that is deployed will not get
network connectivity. This is due to the fact that the network for
the VM in question are not sent in the first blob of data from the VC.
The VC will make use of a token indicating that there is additional
information.

The VC indicates that it has multiple results.

NOTE: Commit 1deb31f85a8f5d1e261b2cf1eddc537a5da7f60b removed the ESX
driver. The retrieval of networks only needs to be done for a cluster
and not a ESX host.

Closes-bug: #1375320

Change-Id: I7299c38410dedd20e3778db3c4f1a63d92b4334c

The instance['numa_topology'] will be set when NUMATopologyFilter
is success. When we have many hosts in the deployment, the
instance['numa_topology'] will be set every times when the filter
is success, and it will be the numa_topology that base on the last

different with the chosen host, it make chosen host consume the

commit_message:
Instance's numa_topology shouldn't be set in filter

The instance['numa_topology'] will be set when NUMATopologyFilter
is success. When we have many hosts in the deployment, the
instance['numa_topology'] will be set every times when the filter
is success, and it will be the numa_topology that base on the last
fitting host. The numa_topology of "last filtered host" may be
different with the chosen host, it make chosen host consume the
instance's numa_topology calculated according to the other fulfill
host.

Change-Id: I731975e8cc99abf32f9c0190a300be441e474db8
Closes-Bug: #1405359

commit_message:
Create a framework for federation plugins

Create a standard base class for federation plugins. This base class has
one abstract method which fetches an unscoped token by the federation
specific method.

The base class is then responsible for handling transitioning from that
unscoped token to a scoped one if any scoping information is provided.

Co-Authored-By: Marek Denis <marek.denis@cern.ch>

Implements: blueprint add-saml2-cli-authentication
Change-Id: I19dbc24e0b8d4a3bd04dd9e14cfbffa8d7148637

commit_message:
Return 404 when executing router-list-on-l3-agent with invalid agent_id

Neutron server returns HTML code 200 when users execute
router-list-on-l3-agent with invalid agent_id.
Users expect HTML code 404 to be returned.

Change-Id: Ifadca8d6573a94abc3580a0de4463b755ef12a24
Closes-bug: 1413500

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-24 13:01:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py'], 'message': "Fix the order of base classes in migrations test cases

Next release of oslo.db is going to break Nova migrations tests: when
a test case cleanup is run it fails to fetch 'schema' attribute of
oslo.db base test case sets in its setup. The problem is that Nova
base test case intentionally removes all attributes from a test case
class instance in its cleanup callback (to ensure there are no memory
leaks).

Inheritance from Nova base test case was actually added when fixing
LP #1410235, so that TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR attribute would be
handled properly (at that time it was done directly in Nova base test
case setUp(), and now it's a separate fixture).

So in order for Nova unit tests to work correctly with new release of
oslo.db we need either to remove inheritance from Nova base test case
or to change the order of base classes to achieve the 'proper' MRO
for migration test cases. The latter can actually be problematic as
we also need to ensure TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR is still handled
properly and not overridden by oslotest base test case.

Related-Bug: #1410235

Change-Id: I5c7d2a391425766a5e8fd61a532b1a1e7d410770
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the order of base classes in migrations test cases

Next release of oslo.db is going to break Nova migrations tests: when
a test case cleanup is run it fails to fetch 'schema' attribute of
oslo.db base test case sets in its setup. The problem is that Nova
base test case intentionally removes all attributes from a test case
class instance in its cleanup callback (to ensure there are no memory
leaks).

Inheritance from Nova base test case was actually added when fixing
LP #1410235, so that TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR attribute would be
handled properly (at that time it was done directly in Nova base test
case setUp(), and now it's a separate fixture).

So in order for Nova unit tests to work correctly with new release of
oslo.db we need either to remove inheritance from Nova base test case
or to change the order of base classes to achieve the 'proper' MRO
for migration test cases. The latter can actually be problematic as
we also need to ensure TIMEOUT_SCALING_FACTOR is still handled
properly and not overridden by oslotest base test case.

Related-Bug: #1410235

Change-Id: I5c7d2a391425766a5e8fd61a532b1a1e7d410770

commit_message:

openstack/python-ironicclient.

 * Clean up exclude list

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-24 19:21:45.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/section_cli_nova_manage_images.xml', 'doc/common/section_cli_glance_manage_images.xml'], 'message': "Adds the Create a backup section (nova, CLI)

Images now have an `image_type` associated with them, which can be
snapshot or the backup type, like 'daily' or 'weekly'.

If the image_type is backup-like, then the rotation factor can be
included, and that causes the oldest backups that exceed the
rotation factor to be deleted.

This patch explains the usage of the nova backup command,
and the rotation mechanisms.

As Dashboard does not provide a user with this possibility,
so, the section is included to the Manage images section
which is related to CLI only.

Change-Id: I58ad41375ae5724b90d3c993395f318f8417e498
Closes-Bug: #1069986
"}]
commit_message:
Adds the Create a backup section (nova, CLI)

Images now have an `image_type` associated with them, which can be
snapshot or the backup type, like 'daily' or 'weekly'.

If the image_type is backup-like, then the rotation factor can be
included, and that causes the oldest backups that exceed the
rotation factor to be deleted.

This patch explains the usage of the nova backup command,
and the rotation mechanisms.

As Dashboard does not provide a user with this possibility,
so, the section is included to the Manage images section
which is related to CLI only.

Change-Id: I58ad41375ae5724b90d3c993395f318f8417e498
Closes-Bug: #1069986

subject: Add new caching class for shade
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-24 17:26:14.000000000', 'files': ['shade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Add new caching class for shade

Shade is caching elements like images, volumes and flavors
that are subject to change (flavor the less of them). Storing
items in a cache makes that changes to elements, like adding
or deleting, or changes of status, are not perceived by the
cache. However, the cache is still needed to improve performance
when several concurrent calls are done.

Add a cache_class to manage it, with a global interval. If set,
allows to invalidate caching if the last hit is too old.
By using this approach we are still able to make heavy use of
caching, but invalidate changes with the interval needed,
according to our usage.

Change-Id: Ia99fbbb9810b13147634d9a54ab087dcdaf881d1
'}]
commit_message:
Add new caching class for shade

Shade is caching elements like images, volumes and flavors
that are subject to change (flavor the less of them). Storing
items in a cache makes that changes to elements, like adding
or deleting, or changes of status, are not perceived by the
cache. However, the cache is still needed to improve performance
when several concurrent calls are done.

Add a cache_class to manage it, with a global interval. If set,
allows to invalidate caching if the last hit is too old.
By using this approach we are still able to make heavy use of
caching, but invalidate changes with the interval needed,
according to our usage.

Change-Id: Ia99fbbb9810b13147634d9a54ab087dcdaf881d1

commit_message:
Use yaml.safe_load() instead of yaml.load()

According to Bandit yaml.safe_load() should be used instead of
yaml.load().

Use of unsafe yaml load. Allows instantiation of arbitrary objects.
Consider yaml.safe_load().

Change-Id: I7dd536c61ff53bf0b07cf4681df64fbec99140b6

commit_message:
[user-guide] instance_name length limitation

Instance names longer than 63 characters get
truncated when turned into hostnames,
as longer names cause dnsmasq to ignore
the entry and not hand out a DHCP address.

Change-Id: I21e222f2e340e755e5a10774e27b54af6ae1850d
Partial-bug: 1415705

commit_message:
Fix v4-fixed-ip parameter usage description in nova command

Currently, v4-fixed-ip parameter is supported(together with net-id
parameter) of the --nic option for the nova command.

add a nova boot sample to show boot with a v4-fixed-ip,
delete the note indicating not support this way

Change-Id: I2aa2ab2869ba15c718afaa5754fcfae19cab4e6c
Closes-Bug: #1412670
Co-Authored-By: yanheven <yanheven@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Using neutron commands with admin tenant

Since the SERVICE_TENANT has been removed, neutron-enabled
environment works no longer, and need to use admin tenant
for querying the private network.

Change-Id: I893978e5e3050d0927e2ff381622c02033b2d26b
Closes-Bug: #1425016

the logging guidelines for i18m, delayed string
interpolation, and non-duplicating strings at different

commit_message:
Sync the 'fileutils' module from oslo-incubator

The fileutils module hasn't been updated since
November of 2014.  We need to bring this module up
to date to support the namespace changes that have
been made.

Current HEAD in OSLO:
---------------------
commit e589dde0721a0a67e4030813e582afec6e70d042
Date:  Wed Feb 18 03:08:12 2015 +0000
Merge "Have a little fun with release notes"

Changes merged with this patch:
---------------------
ac17de97 - Use oslo_utils instead of deprecated oslo.utils
809080ed - Introduce fileutils ensure_dir creation mode parameter

Change-Id: I0bca3cc59126abed8ef736bf5e199857f681e5cd

commit_message:
Add REST API checking for security_group_api(ec2)

This patch adds REST API checking for security_group_api
of ec2:

"ec2_api:authorize_security_group_ingress": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner",
"ec2_api:create_security_group": "",
"ec2_api:delete_security_group": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner",
"ec2_api:describe_security_groups": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner",
"ec2_api:revoke_security_group_ingress": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner"

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
Change-Id: If3bfbab93e454121d7a106c63f7f590a340b7524

commit_message:
Correct order of parameters to assertEqual

The correct order of parameters to assertEqual is (expected,
actual). It makes the assertion message more meaningful when there is
a failure.

Change-Id: I1ab6933d2eee336b41f6ab791e32ad6eaa004a6b
Partial-Bug: #1277104

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-19 23:23:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/local_dev/lvm.py'], 'message': "Remove retry_deactivation directive on lvremove

A while back an LVM_CONF directive was added to
explicitly retry_deactivation on lvremove.  This
was a great idea, but since then the LVM defaults
all seem to set this for us anyway so we don't
really need to send it in the call explicitly
any more.

Also, we've introduced the option to use a cinder
specific lvm.conf file which can be used to set
or unset values like this going forward:
    (commit: eb7bb3e08c1b8e1008ba447b842b635821e2097e)

This patch removes the retry_deactivation directive, but
leaves the ignore_suspended_devices setting as we don't
want to use that all the time, but only during recovery.
There may be better options for this call as well but
that's a possible future improvement unrelated to this
commit.

Change-Id: I167ea9a24cfeeb3716c90c87a0609271d3255ca6
"}]
commit_message:
Remove retry_deactivation directive on lvremove

A while back an LVM_CONF directive was added to
explicitly retry_deactivation on lvremove.  This
was a great idea, but since then the LVM defaults
all seem to set this for us anyway so we don't
really need to send it in the call explicitly
any more.

Also, we've introduced the option to use a cinder
specific lvm.conf file which can be used to set
or unset values like this going forward:
    (commit: eb7bb3e08c1b8e1008ba447b842b635821e2097e)

This patch removes the retry_deactivation directive, but
leaves the ignore_suspended_devices setting as we don't
want to use that all the time, but only during recovery.
There may be better options for this call as well but
that's a possible future improvement unrelated to this
commit.

Change-Id: I167ea9a24cfeeb3716c90c87a0609271d3255ca6

commit_message:
Move policy enforcement into REST API layer for v2.1 ips

This patch moves the policy enforcement into REST API layer for v2.1
ips extension and adds related unittest.

And because ips extension haven't policy rules before, this patch adds
policy rules for it.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I9cf45390af6f60ef420b33b3037f618f67276e88

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-19 02:47:18.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix crash with -l, -d /, and pseudo folders

Using -l, -d /, or a pseduo folder by itself works fine, but if you
combine all of them, this happens:

[zaitcev@guren s]$ swift list -d / testcont
amazon_lili.jpg
pseudodir/
rin_shibuya_pixiv.jpg
swift-c134855-5a.diff
[zaitcev@guren s]$ swift list -d / -l testcont
      151954 2014-06-20 17:13:52 amazon_lili.jpg
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/q/zaitcev/hail/python-swiftclient-tip/bin/swift", line 24, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/q/zaitcev/hail/python-swiftclient-tip/swiftclient/shell.py", line 1301, in main
    globals()['st_%s' % args[0]](parser, argv[1:], output)
  File "/q/zaitcev/hail/python-swiftclient-tip/swiftclient/shell.py", line 414, in st_list
    total_bytes += item_bytes
TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +=: 'int' and 'NoneType'

The patch is a straightforward fix that assigns expected variables.

Change-Id: If24dcc2491e8b8982455107d2aca30c0491a398a
Closes-Bug: 1399678
'}]
commit_message:
Fix crash with -l, -d /, and pseudo folders

Using -l, -d /, or a pseduo folder by itself works fine, but if you
combine all of them, this happens:

[zaitcev@guren s]$ swift list -d / testcont
amazon_lili.jpg
pseudodir/
rin_shibuya_pixiv.jpg
swift-c134855-5a.diff
[zaitcev@guren s]$ swift list -d / -l testcont
      151954 2014-06-20 17:13:52 amazon_lili.jpg
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/q/zaitcev/hail/python-swiftclient-tip/bin/swift", line 24, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/q/zaitcev/hail/python-swiftclient-tip/swiftclient/shell.py", line 1301, in main
    globals()['st_%s' % args[0]](parser, argv[1:], output)
  File "/q/zaitcev/hail/python-swiftclient-tip/swiftclient/shell.py", line 414, in st_list
    total_bytes += item_bytes
TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +=: 'int' and 'NoneType'

The patch is a straightforward fix that assigns expected variables.

Change-Id: If24dcc2491e8b8982455107d2aca30c0491a398a
Closes-Bug: 1399678

commit_message:
update telemetry data collection doc

- link supported tooz drivers
- make more mentions of events
- add in audit.http.* meters that keystone emits
- remove awkwardly placed comment regarding memory.usage
- correct detail that incorrect says notification agent uses interval
- add comment to recommend not storing all data
- add comment to recommend using events for non-metric meters
- fix comment regarding multiple workers per collector on postgres
- clean up ttl text to mention native support and when expirer is used
- update db2 nosql as it is not a supported feature.
- minor wording changes

Change-Id: I2d1fa0aed682beb34597c828a9a758d0d1348385

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-20 13:56:29.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/compute/nova.py', 'cinder/tests/compute/test_nova.py'], 'message': 'Pass region name to Nova client

When using a Novaclient method on a multi-region infrastructure,
requests sometimes fail with an AmbiguousEndpoints Exception,
because more than one Nova endpoint is returned in the catalog.

This patch passes `region_name` and `endpoint_type` from conf to
Novaclient, so this error case is avoided.

Change-Id: Ic4810a1c5223575c6d6300156491437ea67c4a7a
Closes-Bug: #1421314
'}]
commit_message:
Pass region name to Nova client

When using a Novaclient method on a multi-region infrastructure,
requests sometimes fail with an AmbiguousEndpoints Exception,
because more than one Nova endpoint is returned in the catalog.

This patch passes `region_name` and `endpoint_type` from conf to
Novaclient, so this error case is avoided.

Change-Id: Ic4810a1c5223575c6d6300156491437ea67c4a7a
Closes-Bug: #1421314

commit_message:
Libvirt: Allow missing volumes during delete

When deleting an instance, libvirt driver will clear all the volumes
of the instance. Ignore exception when clearing a missing volume
to avoid delete instance error.

Closes-Bug: 1404791
Change-Id: I8a663e8f0396bf2303642610ae1001c330159b75

commit_message:
Make Trove log dir consistent with other OpenStack services

All other OpenStack services log to $DEST/logs (/opt/stack/logs by
default), so ensure that the Trove services are also logging to
that directory for consistency.

Change-Id: I69ea6b66127c06d2f94ca535f3c958a3fd033703

commit_message:
Allow specification of docker volume size

Add field to bay model to specify size of the docker volume. This value
is passed into the kubenode.yaml through kubecluster.yaml to create the
correct size volume.

Change-Id: I079fe0744bd431e24d0432fcd02e9735aa4a3573
Partial-Bug: 1422512

commit_message:
Implement rootwrap daemon support

Add an option to run rootwrap daemon instead of usual rootwrap.

Note that this patch won't work until corresponding patch to
oslo.rootwrap is merged: https://review.openstack.org/81798

Functionality is currently being turned on and tested in this patch to
devstack: https://review.openstack.org/107386

Implements: blueprint rootwrap-daemon-mode
Change-Id: I88abe0c6caa4024dd7db01dca800f5d1686d9c28

commit_message:
Abstract out root_helper calls to classes

This will allow to integrate with rootwrap daemon mode without need to
pass around more than one config variable (object in the new version).

Partially implements blueprint rootwrap-daemon-mode
Change-Id: I748d06c5546fb05e1cf97f526a7f224bc6bc504d

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-23 23:54:43.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/core/manager.py', 'tests/test_functional.py', 'bandit/core/result_store.py', 'bandit/bandit.py', 'bandit.yaml'], 'message': "Adding file discovery and directory exclusion

Bandit has relied on piping the find command to build the test
bed.  This change introduces file discovery capabilities to Bandit,
along with the capability to exclude directories and specify which
file extensions should be scanned.

Excluded directories and file extensions are specified in the
config file.  This change also introduces a '-r' flag which
indicates that Bandit should discover files recursively in a
directory.

Change-Id: I5721f0d067431e8eba2d2c2bc8037560d7b2df71
"}]
commit_message:
Adding file discovery and directory exclusion

Bandit has relied on piping the find command to build the test
bed.  This change introduces file discovery capabilities to Bandit,
along with the capability to exclude directories and specify which
file extensions should be scanned.

Excluded directories and file extensions are specified in the
config file.  This change also introduces a '-r' flag which
indicates that Bandit should discover files recursively in a
directory.

Change-Id: I5721f0d067431e8eba2d2c2bc8037560d7b2df71

subject: Delete mysql error log file as root on restore
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7806, 'name': 'Sushil Kumar', 'email': 'skm.net@gmail.com', 'username': 'sushilkm'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 13355, 'name': 'Edmond Kotowski', 'email': 'ekotowski@gmail.com', 'username': 'ekotowski'}, {'_account_id': 14576, 'name': 'Petr Malik', 'email': 'pmalik@tesora.com', 'username': 'pmalik'}, {'_account_id': 14829, 'name': 'Ashleigh Farnham', 'username': 'ashleighfarnham', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-24 21:39:43.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/strategies/restore/mysql_impl.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_backups.py'], 'message': 'Delete mysql error log file as root on restore

The Problem:
The current code let's Python manage the MySQL error log file generated
during the root password reset on backup restore (see bug/1419995).
The problem is that the database service may assume ownership of that
file in the process. The 'restricted deletion' policy dictates that
only owners (and the directory owner) can delete temporary files.
If this happens the cleanup step fails halting the whole
restore process.
NOTE: Not all datastores necessarily exhibit this behavior
(i.e. taking ownership of the log file).
It has been confirmed on Percona 5.5 running under Ubuntu Linux.

The Reproduction (important):
This issue is masked in the default testing (redstack) environment.
Redstack (in 'scripts/functions_qemu') sets 'GUEST_LOGDIR'
to the 'log_dir' value from 'etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf.sample'
which happenns to be '/tmp/'.
Later in 'scripts/files/trove-guest.upstart.conf' assumes the ownership
of that directory: "chown GUEST_USERNAME:root GUEST_LOGDIR"
effectively hiding this issue (see bug/1423760).
The temporary directory would generally not be owned by the trove user
in a production environment.

In order to reproduce this issue in Redstack set 'GUEST_LOGDIR' to
some directory other than '/tmp', like '/var/log/trove/',
kick-start Percona 5.5 (remember to remove the cached
image if any) and run instance backup/restore or int-tests.

The Solution:
Do not let Trove do the cleanup on the error log file.
Force-delete the file as root, logging but not raising any exceptions.

Tested on: MySQL 5.5/5.6 and Percona 5.5/5.6

Change-Id: I9dd6ed543a01ecc4f84065ea4bf3737960de6e24
Closes-Bug: 1423759
Related-Bug: 1423760
'}]
commit_message:
Delete mysql error log file as root on restore

The Problem:
The current code let's Python manage the MySQL error log file generated
during the root password reset on backup restore (see bug/1419995).
The problem is that the database service may assume ownership of that
file in the process. The 'restricted deletion' policy dictates that
only owners (and the directory owner) can delete temporary files.
If this happens the cleanup step fails halting the whole
restore process.
NOTE: Not all datastores necessarily exhibit this behavior
(i.e. taking ownership of the log file).
It has been confirmed on Percona 5.5 running under Ubuntu Linux.

The Reproduction (important):
This issue is masked in the default testing (redstack) environment.
Redstack (in 'scripts/functions_qemu') sets 'GUEST_LOGDIR'
to the 'log_dir' value from 'etc/trove/trove-guestagent.conf.sample'
which happenns to be '/tmp/'.
Later in 'scripts/files/trove-guest.upstart.conf' assumes the ownership
of that directory: "chown GUEST_USERNAME:root GUEST_LOGDIR"
effectively hiding this issue (see bug/1423760).
The temporary directory would generally not be owned by the trove user
in a production environment.

In order to reproduce this issue in Redstack set 'GUEST_LOGDIR' to
some directory other than '/tmp', like '/var/log/trove/',
kick-start Percona 5.5 (remember to remove the cached
image if any) and run instance backup/restore or int-tests.

The Solution:
Do not let Trove do the cleanup on the error log file.
Force-delete the file as root, logging but not raising any exceptions.

Tested on: MySQL 5.5/5.6 and Percona 5.5/5.6

Change-Id: I9dd6ed543a01ecc4f84065ea4bf3737960de6e24
Closes-Bug: 1423759
Related-Bug: 1423760

Ironic instance doesn't create using "OS::Neutron::Port".
So we should modify this template to below order.

1. Create master vm (and assign fixed ip on given private network)
2. Create minion vm (and assign fixed ip on given private network)
3. Configure minion vm (with master address)
4. Configure master vm (with minion address)

This uses "SoftwareDeployment" to handle dependency.

And there is some limitations derived from ironic:

- Security group doesn't set.
- Disable cinder volume for docker storage.
- Require private network name parameter which provides baremetal network.

commit_message:
Implement a Heat k8s template for Ironic

Ironic instance doesn't create using "OS::Neutron::Port".
So we should modify this template to below order.

1. Create master vm (and assign fixed ip on given private network)
2. Create minion vm (and assign fixed ip on given private network)
3. Configure minion vm (with master address)
4. Configure master vm (with minion address)

This uses "SoftwareDeployment" to handle dependency.

And there is some limitations derived from ironic:

- Security group doesn't set.
- Disable cinder volume for docker storage.
- Require private network name parameter which provides baremetal network.
- Disable default user `minion` at master.

Implements: blueprint ironic-heat-template

Change-Id: Ia661c6ed08887a6a6961fb0ba5d34f2278794658

subject: Send empty dict when no headers on create/update
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8736, 'name': 'Terry Howe', 'email': 'terrylhowe@gmail.com', 'username': 'terrylhowe'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-25 03:20:19.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/object_store/v1/test_container.py', 'openstack/object_store/v1/container.py'], 'message': "Send empty dict when no headers on create/update

When no headers are set on a Container.create, we end up attempting to
send `None` through to the various lower levels, and they depend on
being able to set things like the token on the headers that get sent
through. If `attrs` sent into both Container.create and Container.update
don't actually contain any headers, put an empty dictionary in place of
them.

Change-Id: Iea050976d86a12d7b78245147d3560b188c8a584
"}]
commit_message:
Send empty dict when no headers on create/update

When no headers are set on a Container.create, we end up attempting to
send `None` through to the various lower levels, and they depend on
being able to set things like the token on the headers that get sent
through. If `attrs` sent into both Container.create and Container.update
don't actually contain any headers, put an empty dictionary in place of
them.

Change-Id: Iea050976d86a12d7b78245147d3560b188c8a584

commit_message:
Stale VXLAN and GRE tunnel port/flow deletion

Description:
Stale GRE and VXLAN tunnel endpoints persists in neutron db this should be
deleted from the database. Also, if local_ip of L2 agent changes the
stale tunnel ports and flows persists on br-tun on other Compute Nodes and
Network Nodes for that remote ip this should also be removed.

Implementation

Plugin changes:
The plugin side changes are covered in following patch-set
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/121000/.

Agent changes:
Added tunnel_delete rpc for removing stale ports and flows from br-tun.
tunnel_sync rpc signature upgrade to obtain 'host'.
Added testcases for TunnelRpcCallbackMixin().

This patch-set agent deals with agent side changes.

Closes-Bug: #1179223
Closes-Bug: #1381071
Closes-Bug: #1276629

Co-Authored-By: Aman Kumar <amank@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: phanipawan <ppawan@hp.com>

Neutron Change-Id: I291992ffde5c3ab7152f0d7462deca2e4ac1ba3f
Neutron commit 67c4c6d809e4c9e112d9fb848b5bdce9d5cd04ac

Change-Id: If0969049fd0c4f9132951969fa08364336b1150b

commit_message:
OVS Agent with ML2: fix symlink on RH plateforms

Change the symlink to ensure
/etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini points to
/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini .

/etc/neutron/plugin.ini is not managed by the RH package (OVS neutron
plugin by default) so the OVS agent won't load it.

Source: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1087647

Change-Id: I89364a215eff28652ab424b30911f6bd348f1d47
Closes-bug: #1425213
(cherry picked from commit 163e631895bb0c9f98f11f3f2ff3d99b1f449b49)

commit_message:
Ignore 'dynamic' addr flag on gateway initialization

When initializing the gateway device, if 'dynamic' flag is present
but not ignored, the 'ip addr del' command will fail and nova-network
will fail to startup.
In LinuxBridgeInterfaceDriver, it is correctly ignored.
This adds the same handling of flags in initialize_gateway_device.

Change-Id: Id03e9659a5bec549d6b119cd0ced595875baf0c9
Closes-Bug: #1408142
Related-Bug: #1274611

commit_message:
Make pagination work with deleted marker

Currently, Nova does not paginate correctly if the marker is a
deleted server. When trying to get servers with deleted and marker,
a "BadRequest" error saying that the marker is not found will be
raised.

Fixes the bug by passing read_deleted to context when getting
server to enable to get deleted server as marker.

Change-Id: Icde4e7d251d4497ee8eeb0a573eca3b73aa71466
Closes-bug: #1398086

commit_message:
Replace select-for-update in fixed_ip_associate

MySQL Galera does not support the write-intent locks
that SELECT FOR UPDATE requires. In this patch SELECT
FOR UPDATE in 'fixed_ip_associate' function
was replaced with SELECT and UPDATE.

Closes-bug: #1424792

Change-Id: Icdc00adcc58becba74f10341e15bd870c8dc5826

[{'number': 19, 'created': '2015-02-23 20:06:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Fix migration when image doesn't exist

"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Fix migration when image doesn't exist

When nova is used without shared_storage and glance doesn't have the
images required by the instance anymore, the live block migration code
can't prepare the destination host properly.

This patch catches the case when images are not found in glance, and
copies the missing images from the source host, like the
migrate_disk_and_power_off code already does.

The KVM disk deep copy method is not used because it won't work for AMI
image that depends of AKI/ARI image. kernel and initrd are not considered
by the kvm disk migration because they are readonly file (by the kvm pov)
used only to boot the VM.

Co-Authored-By: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@cloudwatt.com>
Closes-bug: #1270825

Change-Id: If81f8b1bbe3e738579ffe2d8f36807afb77560d8

commit_message:
covert sample_cnt from float type to int

if sample_cnt is a float type,it will raise exception when send a http request
if duration is smaller than 1 but bigger than 0,the value of sample_cnt will
be 0,fix it to be 1 in this situation.

Change-Id: I5c30851a60def8e9f173d212f9c2279ede19a77f
Closes-Bug:#1415307

commit_message:

stackrc defines the isset function, but this function is already
declared in functions-common.

The stackrc sources the `functions` which sources the `functions-common`.

commit_message:
Correct the policy enforcement for v2.1 server-groups

This patch make the policy enforcement to check actual target.
Also remove the hard-code permission check for list with 'all_projects',
add new policy rule: 'os-server-groups:all_projects' instead of it.
And use soft policy enforcement for the index method.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

commit_message:
Separate exceptions into their own file

Extract all the common exceptions from auth_token middleware and put it
into its own file. This is first to prove the concept and as exceptions
will be the most shared component of the other modules.

Change-Id: I5436404788d38c0fee87960139a413af780f0c34
Implements: bp refactor-extract-module

commit_message:
Make keystoneclient functional tests gating

The sample functional test we have in keystoneclient is passing in
experimental, and the proposed patch to copy tempest tests across are
both passing.

At this point we can make this a voting check/gate job.

Change-Id: I1fde5118717d59849786f1eb866c6acd58bd2c58

commit_message:
VMware: Router Type Extension Support

Provide a router type extension. This will enable defining the
type of edge appliance. That is, an exclusive edge or a shared
edge for routing services.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1464d0390c0b3ee7658e7955e6433f2ac078a5fe

commit_message:
Rename test_keystoneclient*

Both of the test modules that perform functional (*cough* integration
*cough*) tests with python-keystoneclient are primarily focused on API
coverage for v2. All the analogous coverage for v3 is in the test_v3*
modules, so these two modules should be renamed so that they're easier
for new contributors to find.

Change-Id: Ib4264e5b9914177c48a63d239c1d05c743d62a26

subject: Rename test_content_types
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-24 20:23:37.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v2.py'], 'message': "Rename test_content_types

This module used to do functional testing to ensure identical responses
for both JSON and XML, but since we have dropped support for XML, the
name of the module doesn't make much sense anymore.

What is left in this module is effectively the v2 parallel of test_v3,
so it should be renamed accordingly to make it easier for new
contributors to find it.

Change-Id: I63aaeacabfc998a3fff88c6959f50376ba960e94
"}]
commit_message:
Rename test_content_types

This module used to do functional testing to ensure identical responses
for both JSON and XML, but since we have dropped support for XML, the
name of the module doesn't make much sense anymore.

What is left in this module is effectively the v2 parallel of test_v3,
so it should be renamed accordingly to make it easier for new
contributors to find it.

Change-Id: I63aaeacabfc998a3fff88c6959f50376ba960e94

commit_message:
Make sure we don't introduce oslo_* imports during backports

Backports may contain new oslo_* namespace usage, while we should not
allow those in Juno and earlier. There were some cases of incorrect
backports that included wrong imports in other projects [1], so it's
better to be proactive here.

[1]: https://launchpad.net/bugs/1420335

Change-Id: Ie720c43334364d5e988399c35e137fdbfa420f54

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-16 14:07:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py'], 'message': "Setup br-tun in secure fail mode to avoid broadcast storms

When not creating br-tun in secure fail mode, there are chances to
get a broadcast storm from br-tun.

For example, this occurs when at least three nodes have the br-tun
OpenFlow rules reset in and a broadcast/multicast packet enters br-tun.

This can happen if:
  * openvswitch is restarted, until the agent reloads the Openflow rules.
  * during neutron-openvswitch-agent restart, br-tun is reset, and there
is a few seconds timeframe where tunnel endpoints are plugged and OF
rules are reset.

Secure fail mode doesn't forward traffic by default if no rule is hit.

For stable/juno: create bridge operation is implemented with the secure_mode
parameter, since we don't have ovsdb transactions in juno, and we need
to creation+fail_mode secure to be atomic to avoid race conditions.

Closes-bug: #1421232

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/ovs_lib.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: Iba5ded14179156decb16dcd4b898c026660f9653
"}]
commit_message:
Setup br-tun in secure fail mode to avoid broadcast storms

When not creating br-tun in secure fail mode, there are chances to
get a broadcast storm from br-tun.

For example, this occurs when at least three nodes have the br-tun
OpenFlow rules reset in and a broadcast/multicast packet enters br-tun.

This can happen if:
  * openvswitch is restarted, until the agent reloads the Openflow rules.
  * during neutron-openvswitch-agent restart, br-tun is reset, and there
is a few seconds timeframe where tunnel endpoints are plugged and OF
rules are reset.

Secure fail mode doesn't forward traffic by default if no rule is hit.

For stable/juno: create bridge operation is implemented with the secure_mode
parameter, since we don't have ovsdb transactions in juno, and we need
to creation+fail_mode secure to be atomic to avoid race conditions.

Closes-bug: #1421232

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/ovs_lib.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: Iba5ded14179156decb16dcd4b898c026660f9653

commit_message:
Fix the ipsec conn issue when peer addr is fqdn

ipsec site connection fails when fqdn is provided for peer addr.
The failure is because the command 'ip route get' expects
ip address.

This patch fixes the issue by resolving the fqdn to the ip address
and using this ip address to the 'ip route get'.

Change-Id: I3e22e8170ffe977ece3d36355a59def9e9d01d94
Closes-bug: #1405413

commit_message:
Add debtcollector to lib/oslo and stackrc

Ensure that the debtcollector library is pulled in
like the other oslo libraries so that devstack can
use it where appropriate.

Also fixes 'test_libs_from_pypi.sh' to not have a huge
single line of libraries; and splits it into multiple
lines so the diffs and code can be easily looked at.

Change-Id: I35ab0ed0e20b6092a41ecb3b6f1aaf0a05f5180e

commit_message:
Add self-installation to venv deployment

Stevedore cannot use auth plugins without keystoneclient being installed
to the environment, causing test failures.

Run "setup.py develop" to add keystoneclient to the venv.

Change-Id: I1880af99ccddc216a53aa9ed85fc986ea2db22e4
Closes-Bug: #1396960

commit_message:
Make some auth error messages more verbose

When specifying OS_URL but not OS_TOKEN the user is given an error about
needing to specify OS_TOKEN with no explanation why.

Expand the error messages to explain that the two values must co-exist.

Change-Id: Ib3208a097997bceece4f2a881b5e4e3285852265

subject: OVS Agent with ML2: fix symlink on RH plateforms
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7155, 'name': 'Sebastien Badia', 'email': 'seb@sebian.fr', 'username': 'sbadia'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagné', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 7462, 'name': 'Ivan Chavero', 'email': 'ichavero@redhat.com', 'username': 'ichavero'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 9500, 'name': 'Matt Fischer', 'email': 'matt@mattfischer.com', 'username': 'mfisch'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-24 18:04:54.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_agents_ml2_ovs_spec.rb', 'manifests/agents/ml2/ovs.pp'], 'message': "OVS Agent with ML2: fix symlink on RH plateforms

Change the symlink to ensure
/etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini points to
/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini .

/etc/neutron/plugin.ini is not managed by the RH package (OVS neutron
plugin by default) so the OVS agent won't load it.

Source: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1087647

Change-Id: I89364a215eff28652ab424b30911f6bd348f1d47
Closes-bug: #1425213
"}]
commit_message:
OVS Agent with ML2: fix symlink on RH plateforms

Change the symlink to ensure
/etc/neutron/plugins/openvswitch/ovs_neutron_plugin.ini points to
/etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini .

/etc/neutron/plugin.ini is not managed by the RH package (OVS neutron
plugin by default) so the OVS agent won't load it.

Source: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1087647

Change-Id: I89364a215eff28652ab424b30911f6bd348f1d47
Closes-bug: #1425213

commit_message:
Add DB table for driver private data

This will allow drivers to store key/value pairs related to an initiator
in the database for any needs they have requiring persisted storage
across cinder service hosts.

blueprint driver-private-data

Change-Id: I2567b95c94f9d16f0fba08d03de7b63c8c6e6ed5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-18 22:39:24.000000000', 'files': ['update.py'], 'message': 'Fix the regex for turning project.lib back to oslo.lib

The existing pattern was using '.' to catch any character, which
included spaces and underscore in some projects although we were
assuming it would only be import statements. This patch changes the
pattern to remember what the character is and use it in the replacement
pattern to avoid breaking symbol names that have "oslo" in them or other
similar cases.

Closes-Bug: #1423361
Change-Id: I0f6995c4204ff8690f17ee97b9b7f9c2042e0cf6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the regex for turning project.lib back to oslo.lib

The existing pattern was using '.' to catch any character, which
included spaces and underscore in some projects although we were
assuming it would only be import statements. This patch changes the
pattern to remember what the character is and use it in the replacement
pattern to avoid breaking symbol names that have "oslo" in them or other
similar cases.

Closes-Bug: #1423361
Change-Id: I0f6995c4204ff8690f17ee97b9b7f9c2042e0cf6

commit_message:
Adds module load check to post up rules script

This commit adds a module check for `ip6_tables` which ensures that runs do not
fail when the `ip6_tables` module is otherwise not loaded. Being that ipv6 is an
optional requirment in icehouse/juno the rules created by this script should be
optionally implemented.

Change-Id: I0ced8ddb9d07b656308ee9813c36fd4dff757ed8
Closes-Bug: #1424748
(cherry picked from commit 923bcd51e808bfabe1a214ca74d73b07b0132079)

commit_message:
Adjust long list handling for Flavor

We just did the same for Image so this is bringing the two together. GET
/flavors returns the short list, and GET /flavors/detail lists the
detailed ones, rather than having the attributes split across the
resources.

Change-Id: I7153be96a95a895668319f6abc7002609e194897

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8257, 'name': 'Brian Curtin', 'email': 'brian@python.org', 'username': 'briancurtin'}, {'_account_id': 8736, 'name': 'Terry Howe', 'email': 'terrylhowe@gmail.com', 'username': 'terrylhowe'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-20 04:07:48.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Serialize Resource types before sending to server

Now that we can have Resource instances as the type of resource.prop, we
need to be able to serialize them before sending them to the server. We
can receive them just fine as responses, but need to get their IDs out
so that the attributes we send in create and update requests work
properly.

This change adds a method on the Resource class that takes the
attributes we're about to create or update and checks if any of them are
Resources. If they are, it replaces that item in the dictionary with its
ID.

Change-Id: I6501f167c31b0df1e5ed7c85d2d7a646e537f832
"}]
commit_message:
Serialize Resource types before sending to server

Now that we can have Resource instances as the type of resource.prop, we
need to be able to serialize them before sending them to the server. We
can receive them just fine as responses, but need to get their IDs out
so that the attributes we send in create and update requests work
properly.

This change adds a method on the Resource class that takes the
attributes we're about to create or update and checks if any of them are
Resources. If they are, it replaces that item in the dictionary with its
ID.

Change-Id: I6501f167c31b0df1e5ed7c85d2d7a646e537f832

subject: Improve Resource.page for single-page usage
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 8257, 'name': 'Brian Curtin', 'email': 'brian@python.org', 'username': 'briancurtin'}, {'_account_id': 8736, 'name': 'Terry Howe', 'email': 'terrylhowe@gmail.com', 'username': 'terrylhowe'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-16 17:55:49.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Improve Resource.page for single-page usage

Resource.list currently handles pagination duties and delegates the
work of each individual page to Resource.page, but it wasn't directly
useful to perform the same purpose. This change makes it so
Resource.page can be used in the same manner as Resource.list, since
Resource.page now yields Resource objects, and Resource.list handles the
multiple request piece of pagination, yielding what it gets back from
page.

One of the strong benefits of this is that at the Proxy level, we can
make methods behave the same regardless of the underlying REST Resource
supporting pagination, and with roughly the same code in the proxy
layer, just a difference between calling list or page. For the seeming
majority of APIs that return unpaginated lists, it'll make for a
consistent experience at the higher level, and the same ease of use for
internal developers.

Change-Id: I0b21b719a473888433d0cc5ec5c69719216689a3
"}]
commit_message:
Improve Resource.page for single-page usage

Resource.list currently handles pagination duties and delegates the
work of each individual page to Resource.page, but it wasn't directly
useful to perform the same purpose. This change makes it so
Resource.page can be used in the same manner as Resource.list, since
Resource.page now yields Resource objects, and Resource.list handles the
multiple request piece of pagination, yielding what it gets back from
page.

One of the strong benefits of this is that at the Proxy level, we can
make methods behave the same regardless of the underlying REST Resource
supporting pagination, and with roughly the same code in the proxy
layer, just a difference between calling list or page. For the seeming
majority of APIs that return unpaginated lists, it'll make for a
consistent experience at the higher level, and the same ease of use for
internal developers.

Change-Id: I0b21b719a473888433d0cc5ec5c69719216689a3

commit_message:
msgpack-python requires g++

msgpack-python when installed from source requires a C++ compiler
installed on the system, otherwise it falls back to the python
implementation.

Change-Id: Iffe1f90f3a70780be22459c3f7a3cddfe47f01ca

subject: Fix lbaas service name on Debian
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-24 22:39:36.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/params.pp'], 'message': "Fix lbaas service name on Debian

On Debian families the service is called neutron-lbaas-service, not
neutron-lbaas-agent. Having the wrong name means puppet can't figure out
how to start the service up.

Change-Id: I5846f2fddb9feef3f628012f3035ce1f51468f6f
"}]
commit_message:
Fix lbaas service name on Debian

On Debian families the service is called neutron-lbaas-service, not
neutron-lbaas-agent. Having the wrong name means puppet can't figure out
how to start the service up.

Change-Id: I5846f2fddb9feef3f628012f3035ce1f51468f6f

Each ovs agent could maintain all l2 population fdb entries locally and
make every fdb add/remove/update operations thread-safe to improve the
reliability. When openvswitch restarts, ovs agent must recreate all

Closes-Bug: #1332450

commit_message:
Maintain l2 population fdb entries locally

Each ovs agent could maintain all l2 population fdb entries locally and
make every fdb add/remove/update operations thread-safe to improve the
reliability. When openvswitch restarts, ovs agent must recreate all
tunnel ports/flows if l2 population is used.

Change-Id: If9e4514db0cc9333fb8c8d28e53f6d1b8e1038a4
Closes-Bug: #1332450

commit_message:
A bug of delete error status lb vip

When I delete the lb vip which is ERROR status, the lbaas namespace's tap
device not be deleted. When I add a new vip used the same ip address, then
the ip can not be used, because the ip address confilict.

Change-Id: I383037ae38b91e1fe36937c23f83e0c88a5b26db
Closes-Bug: #1399114

This fixes a bug introduced by 1330597 which expects all Nexus devices
to return an error message when 'switchport trunk allowed vlan add' is
applied and this CLI currently is not applied.  Instead, code was
changed to get current interface config and check if this config is
not there.  It config currently applied, then 'add' keyword is used
in next config; otherwise, it is omitted.

Change-Id: I403848b73a7e69a3047b6eab337d16d17f293e17
Closes-bug:  #1395122
"}]
commit_message:
Apply 'int allowed vlan' cfg when one not there

This fixes a bug introduced by 1330597 which expects all Nexus devices
to return an error message when 'switchport trunk allowed vlan add' is
applied and this CLI currently is not applied.  Instead, code was
changed to get current interface config and check if this config is
not there.  It config currently applied, then 'add' keyword is used
in next config; otherwise, it is omitted.

Change-Id: I403848b73a7e69a3047b6eab337d16d17f293e17
Closes-bug:  #1395122

commit_message:
Adjust cap on python-ceilometerclient

The release of python-ceilometerclient 1.0.13 has incompatible
requirements with the rest of icehouse. This commit adjusts
the cap to make 1.0.12 the capped version to not install 1.0.13

Change-Id: If4479a0faea29c06a00e18ad7f67cc3f9c165e57

Implements OVSHybridInterfaceDriver for port security on loadbalancer
VIP. Loadbalancer VIP tap device is now plugged into a linux bridge
first, so that iptables rules are created appropriately.  A veth pair
is created to connect the linux bridge to the ovs bridge.

Closes-Bug: #1163569
Change-Id: I064e3c0713000bd0c53f375a7f56a0dfb82c1ecd
"}]
commit_message:
Security groups don't work with vip and ovs plugin

Implements OVSHybridInterfaceDriver for port security on loadbalancer
VIP. Loadbalancer VIP tap device is now plugged into a linux bridge
first, so that iptables rules are created appropriately.  A veth pair
is created to connect the linux bridge to the ovs bridge.

Closes-Bug: #1163569
Change-Id: I064e3c0713000bd0c53f375a7f56a0dfb82c1ecd

commit_message:
Add servertimeout to be configurable for nuage plugin

Allows servertimeout to be configurable from neutron via
nuage_neutron_plugin.ini config value

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3e70d793cfcb4964583267ff8757de29c87a0035
Closes-Bug: #1360485

commit_message:
Use add-flow to add new flow instead of mod-flow

Although when calling ovs-ofctl mod-flows can be used to add flows, but
it is not intended, we should avoid the case.

Change-Id: I9a611b01efed652eb0d2521f84b07ce036e3c94a
Closes-bug: #1360145

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-01-06 23:44:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/constants.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/netns_cleanup_util.py'], 'message': "Move router constants to a specific  module

L3 agent module imports metadata driver module which will use (in
daughter change) router constants. That's why router constants must be
moved outside of L3 agent module to avoid an import loop between the 2
modules.

This change moves router constants to neutron.agent.l3.constants new
module because we cannot move router constants to router_info module
(it would imply an import loop between l3 router_info, l3 ha and
metadata driver modules).

Partially-Implements: bp/restructure-l3-agent
Partial-Bug: #1187102
"}]
commit_message:
Move router constants to a specific  module

L3 agent module imports metadata driver module which will use (in
daughter change) router constants. That's why router constants must be
moved outside of L3 agent module to avoid an import loop between the 2
modules.

This change moves router constants to neutron.agent.l3.constants new
module because we cannot move router constants to router_info module
(it would imply an import loop between l3 router_info, l3 ha and
metadata driver modules).

Change-Id: Ic01edfde2c09578387b9bcbe649d99f1c6c53100
Partially-Implements: bp/restructure-l3-agent
Partial-Bug: #1187102

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-12-18 06:18:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_dvr_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/common/config.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Donnot clear flows when restart ovs-neutron-agent.

At the first time loop of ports handling, ovs-neutron-agent
can rebuild the vlan mapping using current ports information
which can be got from ovs. So that when restarting
ovs-neutron-agent admin can specify the reset_ovs flag to
False to avoid the network interuption if the situation
below not happens:
1, change the router mode, such as normal<->dvr
2, enable/disable L2-pop/Arp-responder
3, change VxLAN UDP Port
4, change veth/patch connection method
5, change patch port name
6, tunnel port add/delete/ip-changed in no-l2-pop mode
7, add/delete one dvr in dvr mode
8, change the dvr mac in dvr mode
So if the config file changes, suggest just reset it.

Change-Id: I9b6e65b1d4e5e15f05541df11d9cb8944eb08bae
Closes-Bug: #1383674
'}]
commit_message:
Donnot clear flows when restart ovs-neutron-agent.

At the first time loop of ports handling, ovs-neutron-agent
can rebuild the vlan mapping using current ports information
which can be got from ovs. So that when restarting
ovs-neutron-agent admin can specify the reset_ovs flag to
False to avoid the network interuption if the situation
below not happens:
1, change the router mode, such as normal<->dvr
2, enable/disable L2-pop/Arp-responder
3, change VxLAN UDP Port
4, change veth/patch connection method
5, change patch port name
6, tunnel port add/delete/ip-changed in no-l2-pop mode
7, add/delete one dvr in dvr mode
8, change the dvr mac in dvr mode
So if the config file changes, suggest just reset it.

Change-Id: I9b6e65b1d4e5e15f05541df11d9cb8944eb08bae
Closes-Bug: #1383674

Strip out a lot of the OSC principals like ClientManager. These only
really make sense when you are trying to juggle auth between multiple
different clients and are confusing here.

Default to using the keystoneclient auth constructs as much as possible

Change-Id: I0e4af38b99c08bd83d306928fff7eaf87ffe85f0

commit_message:
Clean up CLI

Strip out a lot of the OSC principals like ClientManager. These only
really make sense when you are trying to juggle auth between multiple
different clients and are confusing here.

Default to using the keystoneclient auth constructs as much as possible
including using the session when creating the client.

Change-Id: I0e4af38b99c08bd83d306928fff7eaf87ffe85f0

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-11-12 05:28:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py'], 'message': 'Catch NoResultFound exception in get_vm_port_hostid

Cath the NoResultFound exception to avoid the l3
agent full-sync failure.

When the L3 Agent is restarting, the function
get_routers will be called to get all the routers
information which is called full-sync.

And when the RPC request is excuted in the
neutron-server side,the function stacks bellow
called:
l3_rpc.py:sync_routers->l3_dvr_db.py:get_sync_data->
l3_dvr_db.py:get_vm_port_hostid->self._core_plugin.get_port

If the floating ip of the port has been deleted
just right,the self._core_plugin.get_port
will raise exception.

The exception will not be caught. So this will make
the L3 Agent be interrupted and it has to sync
all the routers next cycle. It causes L3 Agent full-sync
fail.

So catch the NoResultFound exception to avoid the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1390920

Change-Id: I8911b941377122ef422aafbaa5eec3cc4b7622e2
'}]
commit_message:
Catch NoResultFound exception in get_vm_port_hostid

Cath the NoResultFound exception to avoid the l3
agent full-sync failure.

When the L3 Agent is restarting, the function
get_routers will be called to get all the routers
information which is called full-sync.

And when the RPC request is excuted in the
neutron-server side,the function stacks bellow
called:
l3_rpc.py:sync_routers->l3_dvr_db.py:get_sync_data->
l3_dvr_db.py:get_vm_port_hostid->self._core_plugin.get_port

If the floating ip of the port has been deleted
just right,the self._core_plugin.get_port
will raise exception.

The exception will not be caught. So this will make
the L3 Agent be interrupted and it has to sync
all the routers next cycle. It causes L3 Agent full-sync
fail.

So catch the NoResultFound exception to avoid the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1390920

Change-Id: I8911b941377122ef422aafbaa5eec3cc4b7622e2

commit_message:
Fix to maintain tenant-name same as project name

- re-used the variable which had the tenant-name in the log message
instead of fetching again from keystone.

Closes-Bug: #1370868

Change-Id: I15afbfec9a1d4f404bee56845b22cb9c86cfdb91

ovs_lib: Introduce get_bridge_name_for_datapath_id

This function returns the name of the bridge with the given datapath-id.

Closes-Bug: #1392581
Related: blueprint ofagent-bridge-setup

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-16 13:50:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py'], 'message': "Fix Pluto pidfile deleting

Basically it is workaround, Pluto daemon doesn't delete his pid file
on CentOS while owner of parent dir is not root. It looks like some
tricky nuance with unlink function in pluto or specific  CentOS
behavoiur.

Change-Id: Ie1504ed5e73b7842e37fef384f16ed13a7f93a23
Closes-Bug: 1331502
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Pluto pidfile deleting

Basically it is workaround, Pluto daemon doesn't delete his pid file
on CentOS while owner of parent dir is not root. It looks like some
tricky nuance with unlink function in pluto or specific  CentOS
behavoiur.

Change-Id: Ie1504ed5e73b7842e37fef384f16ed13a7f93a23
Closes-Bug: 1331502

commit_message:
Cisco N1KV: Missing tenant id in REST call to controller

Missing tenant id in the create port REST API to VSM (controller).
The fix is to add the missing tenant id parameter in the REST API.

Change-Id: Ib8aa1fdb487c85b9286eb5c0b34e683512e13378
Closes-Bug: 1373666

commit_message:
adopt namespace-less oslo imports

oslo.utils is now deprecated, so switching
from oslo.utils to right package oslo_utils.
similarly oslo.serialization also deprecated, it
is also switched to oslo_serialization from
oslo.serialization.

Change-Id: I9655f80bc5addc467e5d7c2c012e64bbabe37760
Closes-Bug: #1409733

commit_message:
Fix CSR1kv router service plugin REST failures due to DB lock timouts

The existing implementation did some operations during DB transactions,
which could lead to deadlocks and timeouts.  This patch changes the
implementation so that those operations are performed outside of the
DB transactions.

Change-Id: I4597b1a84a4077fd2f22fb0c371b2894304f4276
Closes-Bug: #1398433

commit_message:
[WIP] New iptables driver

The main class IptablesDriver provides API for controlling iptables.
FirewallDriver consuming security-groups and taking care of all chains
will follow.

Implements: bp/TBD

commit_message:
lbaas package should be installed before service

There was no explicit ordering between the lbaass service and package
which of course broke stuff.

Change-Id: Ic718f88023c8e8ad41cd9888e230ebb78dcca943

[{'number': 32, 'created': '2014-11-14 14:11:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/constants.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/helpers.py', 'neutron/common/exceptions.py'], 'message': "Remove SELECT FOR UPDATE in ip allocation code

Instead of using a SELECT FOR UPDATE to ensure consistency
put in place an optimistic strategy according to the situation:
1) update the record only if the record contains expected values
or
2) deletes the record straight away and perform a check to
rollback the operation if it wasn't allowed.

IPAvailabilityRange keeps track of which address ranges are still
available for allocation. _try_generate_ip and _allocate_specific_ip
were locking this table to make sure that only one process could
modify the data in the table. With this patch a compare strategy
is in place. The IPAvailabilityRange is updated only if no other
process modified it. If a modification occurred the operation will
be retried after getting a fresh copy of the data from the DB.
IPAllocation is created right after the IP range update.

SELECT FOR UPDATE is removed from _rebuild_availability_ranges.
This function is called if there's no IPAvailabilityRange available
for a subnet or by _update_subnet_allocation_pools which removes
the IPAvailabilityRange associated with the subnet before calling
_rebuild_availability_ranges. In any case no IP can be generated
by another process for this subnet since there's no
IPAvailabilityRange record in the DB. Two processes could perform
_rebuild_availability_ranges at the same time, that's why a
DBDuplicateEntry is catched.

This change moves DB_MAX_ATTEMPTS to constants in order to make it
available for reference from this new code.

In _try_generate_ip IPAllocationFailure is raised instead of
IpAddressGenerationFailure to be consistent with the decorator
_retry_ip_allocation. _generate_ip is refactored accordingly

Partial-bug: #1331564
Closes-bug: #1332923
Closes-bug: #1313851

Co-Authored-By: Carl Baldwin <carl.baldwin@hp.com>

Change-Id: I7eeb687a8071c8f82cadbd51beb4668e371b2d4c
"}]
commit_message:
Remove SELECT FOR UPDATE in ip allocation code

Instead of using a SELECT FOR UPDATE to ensure consistency
put in place an optimistic strategy according to the situation:
1) update the record only if the record contains expected values
or
2) deletes the record straight away and perform a check to
rollback the operation if it wasn't allowed.

IPAvailabilityRange keeps track of which address ranges are still
available for allocation. _try_generate_ip and _allocate_specific_ip
were locking this table to make sure that only one process could
modify the data in the table. With this patch a compare strategy
is in place. The IPAvailabilityRange is updated only if no other
process modified it. If a modification occurred the operation will
be retried after getting a fresh copy of the data from the DB.
IPAllocation is created right after the IP range update.

SELECT FOR UPDATE is removed from _rebuild_availability_ranges.
This function is called if there's no IPAvailabilityRange available
for a subnet or by _update_subnet_allocation_pools which removes
the IPAvailabilityRange associated with the subnet before calling
_rebuild_availability_ranges. In any case no IP can be generated
by another process for this subnet since there's no
IPAvailabilityRange record in the DB. Two processes could perform
_rebuild_availability_ranges at the same time, that's why a
DBDuplicateEntry is catched.

This change moves DB_MAX_ATTEMPTS to constants in order to make it
available for reference from this new code.

In _try_generate_ip IPAllocationFailure is raised instead of
IpAddressGenerationFailure to be consistent with the decorator
_retry_ip_allocation. _generate_ip is refactored accordingly

Partial-bug: #1331564
Closes-bug: #1332923
Closes-bug: #1313851

Co-Authored-By: Carl Baldwin <carl.baldwin@hp.com>

Change-Id: I7eeb687a8071c8f82cadbd51beb4668e371b2d4c

For example, this catches errors like that described/fixed in
I1bfc5af6917c525894eecd8b477d787763edbd02

Bad:
  eventlet.timeout.Timeout(timeout)
  do_something()

Good:
  with eventlet.timeout.Timeout(timeout):
    do_something()

"}]
commit_message:
Add a custom pylint check for misused context managers

Some classes (eg: locking, eventlet.timeout, etc) are intended to only
be used via 'with' statements. This change introduces a pylint check
that verifies certain classes are only used in this way.

For example, this catches errors like that described/fixed in
I1bfc5af6917c525894eecd8b477d787763edbd02

Bad:
  eventlet.timeout.Timeout(timeout)
  do_something()

Good:
  with eventlet.timeout.Timeout(timeout):
    do_something()

Change-Id: I1a51118d951d774bdf78d3944e801e2efc817646

commit_message:
Missing mock causing long tests

The test wasn't mocking a call to change the power state of the fake
node, which was causing this test to account for 14 of 17 seconds
on my machine.

Change-Id: I8fe77ded3365375f569574c24430027053ef0dd3

commit_message:
WIP: Set VLAN tags on l3 gateway ports

When running multiple provider networks as external nets, we have to
use multiple bridges - one per provider network - because the l3 agent
is creating ports without setting the matching VLAN tag on them.

Adding the tag to the ports permits this to be much lighter on machine
configuration, but will break deployments that have a manually
configured VLAN underneath the bridge. To support that we make this
feature be controlled by an option.

Co-Authored-By: Jan Grant <jan.grant@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Chuck Carlino <ccarlino@hp.com>
Fixes-Bug: #1346494
Change-Id: I81d896f8b5356fdc995549f2c00af54b935ef690

commit_message:
NSX: allow for updating network gateway devices

The gateway extensions API disallowed this kind of update.
However, this is supported by the backend, and can be easily
supported by the plugin with minimal changes.

This patch adds supports for updating the list of devices for a
network gateway. As the whole list is treated as a single
attribute, the update will have the effect of replacing the
current device list with the new one.

This patch also adds support for this use case in the fake NSX
API client.

Change-Id: Ib6e70ae92a2b32f475c0fda9255e2b862715f68a
Closes-Bug: #1341791

commit_message:
Allow Sharing Additional IPs Specification

This specification lays out a way to allow additional
IPs to be shared between ports on the same network segment
in order to support active-passive HA for instances in
Neutron.

Change-Id: I5b7aba5d23559d259d7eb6e91c4d8d7be82ee726

commit_message:
Implement full sync for cisco n1kv plugin

Add support to synchronize the state of the neutron database and N1kv VSM(controller)
in Cisco N1kv neutron plugin

DocImpact
This commit introduces a new config option enable_sync_on_start in cisco_plugins.ini
Change-Id: Ic472965a0d402d7d48ae8269c2390f587d02a7e1
Implements: blueprint cisco-n1kv-full-sync

commit_message:
Move policy enforcement into REST API layer for v2.1 server_metadata

This patch moves the policy enforcement into REST API layer for v2.1
server metadata extension and adds related unittest.

Because server-metadata extension haven't policy rules before, this
patch adds rules for it.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: Iec1d7995c5cde6f0574f3a862308b62dad8c8df0

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-01-12 08:56:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/v2_0/client.py', 'neutronclient/common/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Unclear message deleting default security group

Trying to delete default security group from a
non-admin user gives an error "Conflict (HTTP 409)
(Request-ID: req-152c2ec3-1f32-406f-9eeb-bb8ea48a4d11)"
but no message is displayed to the user. This is
confusing as the user does not get to know why is
he not allowed to remove the default security group.

So updated the code to give a more meaningful message
to the user.
Closes-Bug: #1403747

Change-Id: I26f7421a81c109fb3f708962e4ca7b54c7ea4c3c
'}]
commit_message:
Unclear message deleting default security group

Trying to delete default security group from a
non-admin user gives an error "Conflict (HTTP 409)
(Request-ID: req-152c2ec3-1f32-406f-9eeb-bb8ea48a4d11)"
but no message is displayed to the user. This is
confusing as the user does not get to know why is
he not allowed to remove the default security group.

So updated the code to give a more meaningful message
to the user.
Closes-Bug: #1403747

Change-Id: I26f7421a81c109fb3f708962e4ca7b54c7ea4c3c

commit_message:
ML2 Mechanism Driver for vCenter DVS port group creation

Within current ML2 plugin, there is no mechanism driver for vCenter
DVS networks creation. It would benefit users if neutron can support
creation of DVS networks from OpenStack instead of relying on vSphere
client. This change will implement such a mechanism driver for DVS
network creation via vSphere SDK.

implements blueprint ml2-dvs-mech-driver
implements blueprint vsphere-neutron

Change-Id: I8fab6d11b3ae8ddc53cccb1477e16b4eb8f8b597

commit_message:
Correct a test and order of parameters to assertEqual

In debugging a failing test (test_update_heartbeat) I observed that
the test was asserting incorrect values and also that the order of
parameters to assertEqual were inverted. It appears that the order of
parameters to assertEqual is a more widespread problem.

The correct order makes the assertion message more useful.

Change-Id: Ide9f60f8338398ad8e61ad81f4a30058e415f8e9
Closes-Bug: #1424741
Partial-Bug: #1277104

commit_message:
Create Influxdb-Grafana Fuel plugin project in Stackforge

This plugin will install InfluxDB - an open-source,
distributed, time series database. It will also install
Grafana that is a graph editor for InfluxDB

Closes-Bug: #1422381

Change-Id: Ib1a65a4fe11d29703307cb75187a2b4707d1b672

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-24 21:52:37.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/users/resources/compute/v2/image.rst', 'openstack/tests/compute/v2/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/tests/compute/v2/test_image.py', 'openstack/compute/v2/_proxy.py', 'openstack/compute/v2/image.py'], 'message': "Add ImageDetail for extra information

The current Image can only receive the basics returned by a GET
/images, which is just name, id, and links. A call to /images/detail
gives a number of added details, some of which were already in the
Image resource but not set. This change follows with how a few other
basic/detail requests were done, and exposes it through the proxy with
details coming by default (since they're likely expected, and most
useful).

Change-Id: Iadc98cd0f679777b1c6e14711ad00787142221e2
"}]
commit_message:
Add ImageDetail for extra information

The current Image can only receive the basics returned by a GET
/images, which is just name, id, and links. A call to /images/detail
gives a number of added details, some of which were already in the
Image resource but not set. This change follows with how a few other
basic/detail requests were done, and exposes it through the proxy with
details coming by default (since they're likely expected, and most
useful).

Change-Id: Iadc98cd0f679777b1c6e14711ad00787142221e2

commit_message:
Modified plugin contract to include barbican-meta-dto

We expect the barbican-meta-dto to be used for storing a CSR generated
in the stored key mechanism, as well as the plugin_ca_id.  These
fields are added here, but the code that uses them will be added in a
subsequent CR.

Change-Id: I27c20130228a20484ed601020614d45521a348f5
Implements: blueprint identify-cas

commit_message:
Update auth_uri / identity_uri

While testing glance + swift, I noticed that the glance-api.conf and
glance-registry.conf being dropped had incorrect auth_uri /
identity_uri values set.  This change updates auth_uri / identity_uri
throughout to point to the correct keystone_service_adminuri /
keystone_service_internalurl variables.

Change-Id: I3cbbfefe7da54b08bb9a55e4a2ca3a8bd786577d
Closes-Bug: 1425099

subject: Change from ML2 to monolithic plugin
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-24 16:16:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/todo.rst'], 'message': "Change from ML2 to monolithic plugin

Per discussion on the mailing list [1], I think moving to
implementing a full plugin with appropriate mixins is the
preferred approach for OVN. OVN implements it's own control
plane, and I don't see the benefit of running OVN with other
ML2 drivers since OVN can also control physical devices
implementing the VTEP schema from OVSDB.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-February/057560.html

Change-Id: I1d8cf7d47c012be798ce02f22f81f7e9b50fdd94
"}]
commit_message:
Change from ML2 to monolithic plugin

Per discussion on the mailing list [1], I think moving to
implementing a full plugin with appropriate mixins is the
preferred approach for OVN. OVN implements it's own control
plane, and I don't see the benefit of running OVN with other
ML2 drivers since OVN can also control physical devices
implementing the VTEP schema from OVSDB.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-February/057560.html

Change-Id: I1d8cf7d47c012be798ce02f22f81f7e9b50fdd94

commit_message:
Reorganize policy engines

Previously we had a single directory for our Datalog implementation
and the domain agnostic policy engine built on top of that implementation.

This change splits those two conceptually separate things into separate
directories: policy for the Datalog implementation and policy_engines
for the engines built using the Datalog implementation.

Change-Id: I359801e6ec9c65740ab13611be7875fdab788947

commit_message:
add support for ceilometermiddleware data

the data format in ceilometermiddleware uses CADF standard rather
than a schema-less payload of deprecated swift middleware. this patch
adds support for both.

Change-Id: I22f929949e3deeb90d14ddad81ccfce9c9de185c
