revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-17 19:39:05.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/identity/admin/v3/test_trusts.py'], 'message': 'Omitting microseconds when creating a trust

In some cases the expiry time may be rounded up because of microseconds.
For example, we have the following expiry time for a trust:

    2015-02-17T17:34:01.907051Z.

However, if we make a GET request on the trust, the response may contain
the time rounded up to

    2015-02-17T17:34:02.000000Z.

That is why we should omit microseconds when creating a trust.

Closes-Bug: #1422869

Change-Id: I6664c4159e682a5388717297c8d49eddebad3f04
'}]
commit_message:
Omitting microseconds when creating a trust

In some cases the expiry time may be rounded up because of microseconds.
For example, we have the following expiry time for a trust:

    2015-02-17T17:34:01.907051Z.

However, if we make a GET request on the trust, the response may contain
the time rounded up to

    2015-02-17T17:34:02.000000Z.

That is why we should omit microseconds when creating a trust.

Closes-Bug: #1422869

Change-Id: I6664c4159e682a5388717297c8d49eddebad3f04

The swift functional test job was changed to run
tox -e func as sudo [1]. The job first runs functional tests
against keystone, then repeats the tests against tempauth.
The second part of the job requires SWIFT_TEST_CONFIG_FILE
env var to be set to cause the tests to run against tempauth.
The introduction of sudo in [1] causes this env var to be lost,
so the tests run against keystoneauth again.

A tell-tale is that the second run of the functional tests should

commit_message:
Fix swift func tests to run using both auth versions

The swift functional test job was changed to run
tox -e func as sudo [1]. The job first runs functional tests
against keystone, then repeats the tests against tempauth.
The second part of the job requires SWIFT_TEST_CONFIG_FILE
env var to be set to cause the tests to run against tempauth.
The introduction of sudo in [1] causes this env var to be lost,
so the tests run against keystoneauth again.

A tell-tale is that the second run of the functional tests should
output "SKIPPING FUNCTIONAL TESTS SPECIFIC TO AUTH VERSION 3" before
the first line of test results. This has been missing since [1] was
merged.

[1] change id Ifc3e862b0fe86928c3943a41f07cd086d6ace6fe

Change-Id: Ibea153e94e7919b5422a344d365cee3106efb2fe

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-20 21:27:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Ensure the Snat Namespace is deleted

The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/138562 fixes
the problem of qrouter or snat namespaces of deleted routers
being left behind on controller nodes. Infrequently the
snat namespaces are still being left behind.

The reason is that when routers are updated, the L3 agent
request the latest router information from the API server.
If the router has already been deleted, the dictionary
entry for "gw_port_host" is already gone. Then the L3 agent
won't be able to delete the snat namespace.

The patch uses the ex_gw_port info in the RouterInfo cache
to get the gw_port_host name instead of ri['gw_port_host'].

Closes-Bug: #1394043
Change-Id: Ibd83dd6459b6054aeb2317005d4af6c8562dad7d
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure the Snat Namespace is deleted

The patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/138562 fixes
the problem of qrouter or snat namespaces of deleted routers
being left behind on controller nodes. Infrequently the
snat namespaces are still being left behind.

The reason is that when routers are updated, the L3 agent
request the latest router information from the API server.
If the router has already been deleted, the dictionary
entry for "gw_port_host" is already gone. Then the L3 agent
won't be able to delete the snat namespace.

The patch uses the ex_gw_port info in the RouterInfo cache
to get the gw_port_host name instead of ri['gw_port_host'].

Closes-Bug: #1394043
Change-Id: Ibd83dd6459b6054aeb2317005d4af6c8562dad7d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-24 01:45:10.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry.yaml', 'cinder-storage-post.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/cinder-storage-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/cinder-storage-post.yaml'], 'message': "BlockStore: Exec puppet after all configuration

This patch adds a new BlockStoreNodesPostDeployment resource
which can be used along with the environment file to
specify a nested stack which is guaranteed to execute
after all the BlockStore config deployments have executed.

This is really useful for Puppet in that Heat actually
controls where puppet executes in the deployment
process and we want to ensure puppet runs after
all hiera configuration data has be deployed to
the nodes. With the previous approach some of the
data would be there, but allNodes data would not be
guaranteed to be there in time.

As os-apply-config (tripleo-image-elements) have their
ordering controlled within the elements themselves an empty stubbed
in nested stack has been added so that we don't break that
implementation.

Change-Id: I29b3574e341eecd53b2867788f415bff153cfa9f
"}]
commit_message:
BlockStore: Exec puppet after all configuration

This patch adds a new BlockStoreNodesPostDeployment resource
which can be used along with the environment file to
specify a nested stack which is guaranteed to execute
after all the BlockStore config deployments have executed.

This is really useful for Puppet in that Heat actually
controls where puppet executes in the deployment
process and we want to ensure puppet runs after
all hiera configuration data has be deployed to
the nodes. With the previous approach some of the
data would be there, but allNodes data would not be
guaranteed to be there in time.

As os-apply-config (tripleo-image-elements) have their
ordering controlled within the elements themselves an empty stubbed
in nested stack has been added so that we don't break that
implementation.

Change-Id: I29b3574e341eecd53b2867788f415bff153cfa9f

commit_message:
ObjectStore: Exec puppet after all configuration

This patch adds a new ObjectStoreNodesPostDeployment resource
which can be used along with the environment file to
specify a nested stack which is guaranteed to execute
after all the ObjectStore config deployments have executed.

This is really useful for Puppet in that Heat actually
controls where puppet executes in the deployment
process and we want to ensure puppet runs after
all hiera configuration data has be deployed to
the nodes. With the previous approach some of the
data would be there, but allNodes data would not be
guaranteed to be there in time.

As os-apply-config (tripleo-image-elements) have their
ordering controlled within the elements themselves an empty stubbed
in nested stack has been added so that we don't break that
implementation.

Change-Id: I778b87a17d5e6824233fdf9957c76549c36b3f78

This patch adds a new ComputeNodesPostDeployment resource
which can be used along with the environment file to
specify a nested stack which is guaranteed to execute
after all the Compute config deployments have executed.

This is really useful for Puppet in that Heat actually
controls where puppet executes in the deployment
process and we want to ensure puppet runs after
all hiera configuration data has be deployed to
the nodes. With the previous approach some of the
data would be there, but allNodes data would not be
guaranteed to be there in time.

As os-apply-config (tripleo-image-elements) have their
ordering controlled within the elements themselves an empty stubbed
in nested stack has been added so that we don't break that
implementation.

Change-Id: I80bccd692e45393f8250607073d1fe7beb0d7396
"}]
commit_message:
Compute: Exec puppet after all configuration

This patch adds a new ComputeNodesPostDeployment resource
which can be used along with the environment file to
specify a nested stack which is guaranteed to execute
after all the Compute config deployments have executed.

This is really useful for Puppet in that Heat actually
controls where puppet executes in the deployment
process and we want to ensure puppet runs after
all hiera configuration data has be deployed to
the nodes. With the previous approach some of the
data would be there, but allNodes data would not be
guaranteed to be there in time.

As os-apply-config (tripleo-image-elements) have their
ordering controlled within the elements themselves an empty stubbed
in nested stack has been added so that we don't break that
implementation.

Change-Id: I80bccd692e45393f8250607073d1fe7beb0d7396

commit_message:
Deprecate the old mergepy overcloud templates

This patch moves all the related mergepy templates for the
overcloud into a deprecated directory. The Makefile has
been updated so that overcloud.yaml is still generated
at the top level so this shouldn't break end users.

This is to reduce confusion for new users who are learning the
TripleO heat templates and find the fact that we have two full
implementations very confusing.

Change-Id: I0848aca4dee3e37cb4c6089c5f655ad22ac6c5fd

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-19 21:43:55.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/prepare_tripleo.sh'], 'message': "Remove wasteful tripleo workspace-cache cloning

There doesn't appear to be anything in TripleO that relies
on these clones. Also, this is a bit confusing since people
may expect that things copied into ~workspace-cache would
eventually end up at /opt/git/ (this is not the case).

The correct way to add projects to a job is to export a
PROJECTS variable like devstack-gate does.

Change-Id: I0a96855ed9a38bcade6e506b37621b6b7b348b49
"}]
commit_message:
Remove wasteful tripleo workspace-cache cloning

There doesn't appear to be anything in TripleO that relies
on these clones. Also, this is a bit confusing since people
may expect that things copied into ~workspace-cache would
eventually end up at /opt/git/ (this is not the case).

The correct way to add projects to a job is to export a
PROJECTS variable like devstack-gate does.

Change-Id: I0a96855ed9a38bcade6e506b37621b6b7b348b49

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-23 05:38:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/network/security_group/test_neutron_driver.py', 'nova/network/security_group/neutron_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix 500 when deleting a not existing ec2 security group

There are 2 reason for seeing 500 errors on not existing ec2 security
group delete attempt:

* Unexpected TypeError raised: expected string or buffer
* Unexpected UnboundLocalError raised: local variable 'group' referenced
  before assignment

Fix the problems by catching the TypeError and raising NotFound
exception explicitly.

Change-Id: Iab9a4f99b965dbdd3419ea7585e8a4988eb738ae
Closes-bug: #1410172
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 500 when deleting a not existing ec2 security group

There are 2 reason for seeing 500 errors on not existing ec2 security
group delete attempt:

* Unexpected TypeError raised: expected string or buffer
* Unexpected UnboundLocalError raised: local variable 'group' referenced
  before assignment

Fix the problems by catching the TypeError and raising NotFound
exception explicitly.

Change-Id: Iab9a4f99b965dbdd3419ea7585e8a4988eb738ae
Closes-bug: #1410172

commit_message:
Run restrict-memory element later in image build

Since grub isn't installed by DIB until finalise.d/51 we need to
make sure the restrict-memory element happens after that, so it can
find and alter the grub configs accordingly.

Also make it apply the updated configuration, similar to how
nodepool/scripts/restrict_memory.sh does it.

Change-Id: I854f3bd1850594811cc8957f7a9263c33dfe6826

revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-02-24 13:19:48.000000000', 'files': ['designate/central/service.py', 'designate/tests/test_central/test_service.py'], 'message': "Retry transactions on database deadlocks

Retry transactions upon database deadlocks, helping to ensure all
requests are processed even while there is contention on the
domain.serial column.

Additionally, due to the copy.deepcopy() introduced in the retry decorator, code which previously relied in the input values to central being mutated in place (only the tests, as everything else was over RPC so couldn't have been mutated in place) can no longer rely on this behavior.

Change-Id: Id470608d7cc6c34c133803ba34b9bf242dc5e6ae
Closes-Bug: 1408336
"}]
commit_message:
Retry transactions on database deadlocks

Retry transactions upon database deadlocks, helping to ensure all
requests are processed even while there is contention on the
domain.serial column.

Additionally, due to the copy.deepcopy() introduced in the retry decorator, code which previously relied in the input values to central being mutated in place (only the tests, as everything else was over RPC so couldn't have been mutated in place) can no longer rely on this behavior.

Change-Id: Id470608d7cc6c34c133803ba34b9bf242dc5e6ae
Closes-Bug: 1408336

subject: Go button on the Instance Log page should be enable all the time.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9576, 'name': 'Thai Tran', 'email': 'tqtran@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'tqtran'}, {'_account_id': 10442, 'name': 'Masco Kaliyamoorthy', 'email': 'mkaliyam@redhat.com', 'username': 'masco'}, {'_account_id': 10732, 'name': 'Hiroki Aramaki', 'email': 'h-aramaki@netone.co.jp', 'username': 'haramaki'}, {'_account_id': 12826, 'name': 'Rob Cresswell', 'display_name': 'robcresswell', 'email': 'robert.cresswell@outlook.com', 'username': 'rob-cresswell'}, {'_account_id': 14064, 'name': 'Kahou Lei', 'email': 'kahou82@gmail.com', 'username': 'kahou82'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-23 18:21:02.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/templates/instances/_detail_log.html'], 'message': 'Go button on the Instance Log page should be enable all the time.

The "Go" button on the instance log page will be disable after user clicked on it. User needs to refresh the page again to make the button enable.
 
Steps to reproduce.

1. Spin up an instance.
2. Once the instance is up, click the View Log action.
3. On the view log page, enter some valid value on the Log Length text box.
4. Click "Go" button.
5. Once the page is refreshed, you will notice that the Go button become disable forever.

The root cause is due to Horizon button will be disabled once user submitted a form.
This behavior works great with regular form submission such as create an instance etc.

However view log page seems to be a single page application. That is, browser does not need to refresh the page to view the log with updated log length. Therefore, we need to mark the "Go" button
to be enabled all the time.

Change-Id: I1e8d582595eb6825109709bd2e31bfb6f1e6d6ba
Closes-Bug: #1424244
'}]
commit_message:
Go button on the Instance Log page should be enable all the time.

The "Go" button on the instance log page will be disable after user clicked on it. User needs to refresh the page again to make the button enable.
 
Steps to reproduce.

1. Spin up an instance.
2. Once the instance is up, click the View Log action.
3. On the view log page, enter some valid value on the Log Length text box.
4. Click "Go" button.
5. Once the page is refreshed, you will notice that the Go button become disable forever.

The root cause is due to Horizon button will be disabled once user submitted a form.
This behavior works great with regular form submission such as create an instance etc.

However view log page seems to be a single page application. That is, browser does not need to refresh the page to view the log with updated log length. Therefore, we need to mark the "Go" button
to be enabled all the time.

Change-Id: I1e8d582595eb6825109709bd2e31bfb6f1e6d6ba
Closes-Bug: #1424244

commit_message:
Changed the log format for horizon's apache configuration

The default apache log format is noisy. Added a custom log format
that matches the other apache log format of projects like keystone

Closes-Bug: #1222900

Some of the extensions in IPA currently do not return any values
from their respective command methods. This results in a lack of a
paper trail of the command_result value to the point where it is

a command succeeded or failed.

This change adds more logging to the extensions and provides return
values which are used in the command_result property on
(Async|Sync)CommandResult instances to provide useful debug info.

While creating this patch several unit tests for *CommandResult objects
were found to be using invalid data that would not pass validation

Closes-Bug: 1408080

commit_message:
Add additional logging and return results for IPA extensions

Some of the extensions in IPA currently do not return any values
from their respective command methods. This results in a lack of a
paper trail of the command_result value to the point where it is
not possible to know more information than a boolean result of if
a command succeeded or failed.

This change adds more logging to the extensions and provides return
values which are used in the command_result property on
(Async|Sync)CommandResult instances to provide useful debug info.

While creating this patch several unit tests for *CommandResult objects
were found to be using invalid data that would not pass validation
if returned in API results. Those have been corrected in this patch.

Change-Id: I23bae25a83881e7013c93d73f858c622ea941253
Closes-Bug: 1408080

commit_message:
Create service definition for nova-serialproxy

Nova has the ability to do remote interactive consoles but there is no
easy way to enable this in devstack.  This change defines a service
called n-serial to enable the service.  Documentation is added to a
new guide on nova, describing how to set further options in local.conf

Change-Id: I401d94b2413c62bfae9b90d2214d77bd4cfc15d5

DB functions exist to get all volumes, to get all volumes in a particular

hosted on a particular host. See the following functions in the DB API:

Only the queries that get all volumes and that get all volumes by project

across these APIs, adding it to the volume_get_all_by_group and the

commit_message:
Generic filter support for volume queries

DB functions exist to get all volumes, to get all volumes in a particular
project, to get all volumes in a particular group, and to get all volumes
hosted on a particular host. See the following functions in the DB API:

* volume_get_all
* volume_get_all_by_project
* volume_get_all_by_group
* volume_get_all_by_host

Only the queries that get all volumes and that get all volumes by project
support additional filtering.

The purpose of this patch set is to make the filtering support consistent
across these APIs, adding it to the volume_get_all_by_group and the
volume_get_all_by_host APIs.

Change-Id: I6af9b4de9e70ec442e7e61c6b0baa9b02798a06d
Implements: blueprint db-volume-filtering

commit_message:
Change use of random to random.SystemRandom

There's no reason to use random directly unless the code really
requires a pseudo-random number generator. This is for security
hardening and identified by the security static analysis project
called Bandit.

SecImpact

Change-Id: I6b5fdd8ab17ec6ed2cb8c195bee1fb5da0e90e9f

commit_message:
Enhancing resiliancy through retries

The agent framework should be more resiliant to errors that can occur.
Most of the errors are temporary and simply need a retry.

This change set adds two pieces:
 - Retries down to the API for list functions.
 - A general retry mechanism to the rpc_loop for all subclassed agents.

Adds a unit test for the retry within the rpc_loop as well.

Change-Id: I05745cdc988e0226a415505622ecf1af0cf14469

subject: Enable override of container update headers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 12279, 'name': 'Janie Richling', 'email': 'jrichli@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jrichli'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-24 15:41:47.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/probe/test_object_async_update.py'], 'message': 'Enable override of container update headers

Crypto middleware needs to arrange for alternative
values of etag and content-type to be sent to container
servers with updates, since these will be encrypted with
a different key than the etag and content-type stored on
the object server.

This patch modifies the object server to overwrite the etag
and content-type values in the container update headers with
values that may optionally be specified by middleware in
X-Backend-Update-Override-* headers.

Using the X-Backend- prefix ensures that these headers
cannot be sent or seen by clients.

A new probe test verifies the propagation of override
values from an internal client through the proxy, to
object server, to container server and then returned
in a container listing.

Change-Id: I7d846ed54ff173d08c66c6d5b0ecf7dff27f5a87
'}]
commit_message:
Enable override of container update headers

Crypto middleware needs to arrange for alternative
values of etag and content-type to be sent to container
servers with updates, since these will be encrypted with
a different key than the etag and content-type stored on
the object server.

This patch modifies the object server to overwrite the etag
and content-type values in the container update headers with
values that may optionally be specified by middleware in
X-Backend-Update-Override-* headers.

Using the X-Backend- prefix ensures that these headers
cannot be sent or seen by clients.

A new probe test verifies the propagation of override
values from an internal client through the proxy, to
object server, to container server and then returned
in a container listing.

Change-Id: I7d846ed54ff173d08c66c6d5b0ecf7dff27f5a87

commit_message:
Separate ML2 agent framework from logic

There are a few pieces of framework that are required to have the ML2
agent properly communicate with the plugin and Neutron server.  This
change set separates out a baseline set of classes specific PowerVM
agents can use to extend for differening technology bases.

The result is that the SharedEthernetNeutronAgent is focused primarily
on the logic needed to provision against a SharedEthernetAdapter (or
NetworkBridge via the API).

Also changed looping approach to be time based.

Change-Id: Ia4a369d4b20cf084a9a28cf701fe94efaa252a2d

The volume driver is a new construct that will connect the I/O Server to
a backing Cinder Volume.  This is a bit different from a standard
localdisk that will be provided via Glance.

This change set refactors the Glance disk work into a disk directory.
The cinder volume driver is then defined in a new 'volume' directory.
This will contain the driver volumes, such as NPIV and vSCSI.

The volume driver is built off the LibvirtBaseVolumeDriver model, but
can't extend that directly as that does contain libvirt specific code.
Eventually, we may be able to provide a common volume driver super class
that all drivers can utilize.

Change-Id: I2aafe2a97da8b195b74d57e8e88cb72389f69ac2
"}]
commit_message:
Initial refactoring for Volume Driver

The volume driver is a new construct that will connect the I/O Server to
a backing Cinder Volume.  This is a bit different from a standard
localdisk that will be provided via Glance.

This change set refactors the Glance disk work into a disk directory.
The cinder volume driver is then defined in a new 'volume' directory.
This will contain the driver volumes, such as NPIV and vSCSI.

The volume driver is built off the LibvirtBaseVolumeDriver model, but
can't extend that directly as that does contain libvirt specific code.
Eventually, we may be able to provide a common volume driver super class
that all drivers can utilize.

Change-Id: I2aafe2a97da8b195b74d57e8e88cb72389f69ac2

The protocol to use was hard-coded as 'saml2', limiting attempts to
authenticate to urls in the form of
v3/OS-FEDERATION/identity_providers/.*?/protocols/saml2/auth
The protocol can now be passed as an option when instantiating the

Change-Id: I5f5f9a409f88f1adf2f2a42fd1f0625ee87c4075
Closes-Bug: 1380779
"}]
commit_message:
Add protocol as an argument for unscoped SAML-based plugins

The protocol to use was hard-coded as 'saml2', limiting attempts to
authenticate to urls in the form of
v3/OS-FEDERATION/identity_providers/.*?/protocols/saml2/auth
The protocol can now be passed as an option when instantiating the
auth plugin.

Change-Id: I5f5f9a409f88f1adf2f2a42fd1f0625ee87c4075
Closes-Bug: 1380779

commit_message:
Optimizing VLAN Application

This change enables batched VLAN processing for ports that get added to
the neutron agent.  This should greatly speed up the heal and optimize
methods.  If there are many ports provisioned at once, this will also
speed up that invocation.

Change-Id: Ie1a2c3946f9c304c4e2841ebb6a37d4a983a2917

commit_message:
Always use adminAuthMethod value

Previously, it would use token authentication if adminToken was set
regardless of the value of adminAuthMethod

Also, remove authentication using Keystone v2 since it will be
deprecated shortly

Remove special HP handling for endpoints and services since it
isn't required anymore

Simplify the code by getting rid of some unneeded generics

Closes-Bug: 1403175

Change-Id: I27e563d68e5266703111f82ab032dc13131f1304

commit_message:
pkg-map: respect --missing-ok also on missing pkg-map file

When there is no pkg-map file for the specified element, list the passed
packages if --missing-ok is specified.

This mirrors what is being done already later, when a pkg-map file
exists but it does not have the mapping for the requested package.

Change-Id: I50287f8e6a5e4335deb3de2252075b8bfdd53ce5

commit_message:
Monitor agent to monitor OVSDB servers immediately

Current logic of the L2gw agent periodically monitors
the OVSDB servers. If the plugin sets a particular
agent as the Monitor agent, the agent waits for the
next cycle to start monitoring the OVSDB servers.
The patch set makes the Monitor agent start monitoring
the OVSDB servers instantly.
The patch set also removes the periodic task and
makes use of FixedIntervalLoopingCall.

Change-Id: I2ab50d92fb3f084b46efb49b02ee17bbed3cd2ab

commit_message:
Describe HA controller role more precisely

* Heat is a core component and always installed.
* Describe which HA components Fuel configures as
  Active/Active and which ones as Active/Passive.
* Fix controller node HA deployment details for RabbitMQ, MySQL,
  HAproxy, Neutron agents.
* Describe why it is required >=3 controller nodes for HA
* Provide a reference to HA-guide as we don't want to duplicate
  the description of basic HA concepts in Fuel docs.
* Fix terminology for HA stanza, add missing term references
* Remove duplicating sections for controller node description and
  terms

Related bug: #1415398

Change-Id: I5b1d6830b43de871120157448c6df68ccd327c9d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6456, 'name': 'Sahdev Zala', 'email': 'spzala@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'spzala'}, {'_account_id': 7193, 'name': 'Thomas Spatzier', 'email': 'thomas.spatzier@icloud.com', 'username': 'thomasspatzier'}, {'_account_id': 9591, 'name': 'Ton Ngo', 'email': 'ton@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'tango'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 22, 'created': '2015-02-23 18:19:03.000000000', 'files': ['translator/tests/data/tosca_elk.yaml', 'translator/toscalib/tpl_relationship_graph.py', 'translator/tests/test_elk.py', 'translator/hot/syntax/hot_resource.py'], 'message': 'New custom type, unit test and template for use case

Add TOSCA template for testing:  this represents the first part
of the monitoring use case, deploying mongodb and nodejs onto
2 servers.  A nodejs application is also installed and started.
For testing, the nodejs application is set as sample, but for real
deployment, change it to some real application like:
https://github.com/paypal/rest-api-sample-app-nodejs.git
The new unit test will translate to Heat and validate the output.
Also include change for the keyword input -> inputs in the
template.

Change-Id: Ia2eabe030669fc0b0f52a9c2c1cc754a4b68a394
'}]
commit_message:
New custom type, unit test and template for use case

Add TOSCA template for testing:  this represents the first part
of the monitoring use case, deploying mongodb and nodejs onto
2 servers.  A nodejs application is also installed and started.
For testing, the nodejs application is set as sample, but for real
deployment, change it to some real application like:
https://github.com/paypal/rest-api-sample-app-nodejs.git
The new unit test will translate to Heat and validate the output.
Also include change for the keyword input -> inputs in the
template.

Change-Id: Ia2eabe030669fc0b0f52a9c2c1cc754a4b68a394

It turned out that PRIMERGY BX920 S4 doesn't turn on from power off
state when PXEDeploy.deploy called the reboot method of the power
driver I/F.
This patch makes sure that pxe_irmc driver can initiate deployment for
any models.

Change-Id: I7abaf75257b33002cbdcf6eb48a0fd2af43ab8e2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix reboot logic of iRMC Power Driver

It turned out that PRIMERGY BX920 S4 doesn't turn on from power off
state when PXEDeploy.deploy called the reboot method of the power
driver I/F.
This patch makes sure that pxe_irmc driver can initiate deployment for
any models.

Change-Id: I7abaf75257b33002cbdcf6eb48a0fd2af43ab8e2

commit_message:
Add BadStoreConfiguration handling to glance-api

Glace-api now handles BadStoreConfiguration exceptions from glance-store
library.

create_stores method will raise BadStoreConfiguration exception on
driver configuration errors on start up so we can abort service start
for the user to fix those errors.

Change-Id: Ifc038874aa0388b036729790a883ae1e1efd323d
Partial-Bug: #1422699

commit_message:

Ica4938d9962bbb402e26dd47f0aea502ea0c4245.

Given the FFE deadline, the fact we have a +2 on the change, the code is
functionally OK and the timezones that the authors and reviewers are in,
this was better to do than rev the driver changes again.

object storage (i.e radosgw) and added corresponding unittests.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Add running environment for rally worker

A single instance of `rally.aas.worker.WorkerManager` is created
within the *rally-worker* process, and is responsible for performing
all actions on rally resources (Deployment, Task, etc.).
Commands are received via RPC calls.

Change-Id: I2361a32f774bfb8a1fecb99a16bdd72c74a6caf7

commit_message:

Missing reverse call in a modal form refactor
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/156302/) has broken the N1k create
view. This patch addresses the missing reverse.

commit_message:
Create loopback devices for mcollective

Mcollective will serve requests to mount
devices on loopback devices, so it is necessary
to ensure loopback devices are available.

Change-Id: I05dbf0b7dd83c6279afe02911f3ea9a2050183c2
Closes-Bug: #1417613

commit_message:
Replaced periodic task with a loopingcall

The logic of periodic task in the L2gw agent
for connecting to the configured OVSDB servers
did not take into account the periodic
interval that is specified in the
l2gateway_agent.ini file.
Therefore, this patch set replaces the periodic
task with a looping call.

Change-Id: I7de0272479ce3a8f2f6be837668088379b5ed18d

commit_message:
Do not allow image management for non-admins

Non-admin users are not allowwed to change glance metadata, so we should hide
all buttons, that target that action.

The whole panel was not hide, since user should be informed this all images,
avaliable in Murano.

Change-Id: Ib86262449c07682ece0e3990c47112d80390271d
Closes-Bug: #1423841

_dnsdomain_get was using for update locking, which would not be
permitted for a read transaction. Inspection showed that this locking

commit_message:
WIP: Update db dnsdomain api to use new oslo_db enginefacade

This change requires an unmerged oslo.db patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/138215/

_dnsdomain_get was using for update locking, which would not be
permitted for a read transaction. Inspection showed that this locking
was redundant in any case, so this change also removes it, and
refactors the 2 callers (dnsdomain_register_for_project and
dnsdomain_register_for_zone) to avoid the redundant query.

Change-Id: Ia6e21d54250ca9ba6448e2dc62e3439b473e7bf6
